question: What is SynKro?
answer: SynKro is a collaborative academic platform designed to help students and faculty manage projects, share resources, and track progress seamlessly. It's your central hub for all project-related activities.

question: Tell me more about SynKro
answer: SynKro is a collaborative academic platform designed to help students and faculty manage projects, share resources, and track progress seamlessly. It's your central hub for all project-related activities.

question: What does this platform do?

question: How do I sign up for SynKro?
answer: You can sign up using your university email address. Click the 'Sign Up' button on the homepage and follow the on-screen instructions. A verification link will be sent to your email.

question: What's the registration process?
answer: You can sign up using your university email address. Click the 'Sign Up' button on the homepage and follow the on-screen instructions. A verification link will be sent to your email.

question: How do I create a new account?
answer: You can sign up using your university email address. Click the 'Sign Up' button on the homepage and follow the on-screen instructions. A verification link will be sent to your email.

question: Where is the sign up page?
answer: You can sign up using your university email address. Click the 'Sign Up' button on the homepage and follow the on-screen instructions. A verification link will be sent to your email.

question: Is SynKro free for students?
answer: Yes, SynKro is provided free of charge to all students and faculty members affiliated with our partner institutions.

question: Do I need to pay to use SynKro?
answer: No, SynKro is provided free of charge to all students and faculty members affiliated with our partner institutions.

question: What is the price of SynKro?
answer: SynKro is provided free of charge to all students and faculty members affiliated with our partner institutions. There is no cost for users at eligible universities.

question: How do I get started?
answer: Welcome to SynKro! The best way to start is by completing your profile, and then either creating your first project or accepting an invitation to join an existing one. Check out the 'Get Started' guide on your dashboard.

question: What are the first steps?
answer: Welcome to SynKro! The best way to start is by completing your profile, and then either creating your first project or accepting an invitation to join an existing one. Check out the 'Get Started' guide on your dashboard.

question: Is there a tutorial?
answer: Yes, upon your first login, you'll be offered an interactive tour of the platform's key features. You can also access tutorials and guides anytime from the 'Help' or 'Resources' menu.

question: Where can I find documentation?
answer: You can find comprehensive documentation, guides, and video tutorials in the 'Help Center', accessible from the main navigation menu.

question: What kind of projects can I manage here?
answer: SynKro is designed for a wide range of academic projects, including group assignments, research projects, capstone projects, lab work, and thesis development. It's flexible enough to handle any collaborative academic work.

question: What is the purpose of the dashboard?
answer: Your main dashboard is your personal landing page. It provides a high-level overview of everything you're involved in, including your projects, a list of tasks assigned to you across all projects, and recent notifications.

question: Explain the main dashboard.
answer: Your main dashboard is your personal landing page. It provides a high-level overview of everything you're involved in, including your projects, a list of tasks assigned to you across all projects, and recent notifications.

question: Do you have a mobile app?
answer: Currently, we do not have a dedicated native mobile app. However, the SynKro web application is fully responsive and designed to work great on modern mobile browsers on both iOS and Android devices.

question: Can I use this on my phone?
answer: Yes, absolutely. The SynKro website is mobile-friendly and can be accessed from the browser on your smartphone.

question: How do I reset my password?
answer: To reset your password, click the 'Forgot Password' or 'Can't log in?' link on the login page. Enter your university email, and we'll send you instructions to create a new password.

question: I forgot my password
answer: No problem. Just click the 'Forgot Password' link on the login page. Enter your university email, and you'll receive a link to reset your password.

question: I can't log in.
answer: If you're having trouble logging in, please double-check your email and password. If you've forgotten your password, you can use the 'Forgot Password' link on the login page to reset it.

question: Where is the password reset link?
answer: The 'Forgot Password' link is located on the main login page, right below the password input field.

question: Can I change my password?
answer: Yes, you can change your password at any time for security. Go to 'Account Settings' -> 'Security' and you will find the option to update your password.

question: How to set a new password?
answer: To set a new password, visit the 'Security' tab in your 'Account Settings'. You will need to enter your current password and then your new password twice.

question: How to update my profile picture?
answer: Navigate to your 'Profile' page by clicking your name or icon in the top right corner. Then, click on your current avatar or the placeholder icon to upload a new image from your device.

question: Where can I change my avatar?
answer: You can change your avatar on your 'Profile' page. Click your current profile picture, and you'll be prompted to upload a new one.

question: I want to upload a new photo of myself.
answer: You can upload a new photo by going to your 'Profile' page and clicking on the circular image area where your current photo (or a placeholder) is shown.

question: How can I change my profile info?
answer: You can edit your profile information, such as your name, major, or bio, by going to your 'Profile' page and clicking the 'Edit Profile' button.

question: How to edit my bio?
answer: Your bio can be edited on your 'Profile' page. Click the 'Edit Profile' button and you will find a field to update your bio.

question: How do I change my display name?
answer: Your display name can be changed from your 'Profile' page. Click the 'Edit Profile' button and update the name fields as needed.

question: My name is spelled wrong, how can I fix it?
answer: You can correct your name by visiting your 'Profile' page and clicking the 'Edit Profile' button. There you can update your first and last name.

question: Can I change the email address associated with my account?
answer: Since your account is tied to your official university email, you generally cannot change it to a personal email address. If you have changed your official university email, please contact support for assistance in migrating your account.

question: How do I manage my email notifications?
answer: Go to 'Account Settings' -> 'Notifications'. From there, you can customize which email notifications you receive, such as for new tasks, mentions, or announcements.

question: I get too many emails from SynKro
answer: You can customize your email preferences. Go to 'Account Settings' -> 'Notifications' to select the exact types of updates you want to be notified about via email.

question: How to stop getting emails?
answer: To reduce or stop emails, please visit your 'Account Settings', then go to the 'Notifications' tab. You can toggle off the email notifications you no longer wish to receive.

question: Where can I unsubscribe from emails?
answer: You can manage all your notification preferences, including unsubscribing from certain emails, in the 'Notifications' section of your 'Account Settings'.

question: Can I link my Google account?
answer: Yes, for easier login, you can link your Google account. Go to 'Account Settings' -> 'Security' or 'Integrations' and follow the prompts to connect your Google account.

question: How do I log in with Google?
answer: On the login page, you will see a 'Sign in with Google' button. If you have already linked your account, you can use this for quick, password-free access.

question: How to delete my account?
answer: To delete your account, please go to 'Account Settings' -> 'Security'. You will find a 'Delete Account' option at the bottom. Please be aware that this action is permanent and cannot be undone.

question: I want to close my SynKro account.
answer: We're sorry to see you go. To permanently close your account, navigate to 'Account Settings' -> 'Security' and select the 'Delete Account' option. All your data will be permanently removed.

question: What happens when I delete my account?
answer: Deleting your account is permanent. All your personal information, projects you own, files you've uploaded, and messages you've sent will be erased from our system in accordance with our data policy. This cannot be reversed.

question: How do I log out?
answer: To log out of your account, click on your profile picture or name in the top-right corner of the screen, and then select 'Log Out' from the dropdown menu.

question: How to sign out of SynKro?
answer: You can sign out by clicking on your profile icon in the top navigation bar and then choosing the 'Log Out' option from the menu.

question: Can I change the theme from light to dark mode?
answer: Yes, you can switch between light and dark themes. Go to 'Account Settings' -> 'Appearance' to select your preferred theme.

question: How to turn on dark mode?
answer: To turn on dark mode, navigate to your 'Account Settings', find the 'Appearance' or 'Theme' section, and select the 'Dark' option.

question: How to see my login history?
answer: For security purposes, you can view a list of recent login activity on your account. Go to 'Account Settings' -> 'Security' and look for a 'Login History' or 'Active Sessions' section.

question: Can I see where my account is logged in?
answer: Yes, in the 'Security' area of your 'Account Settings', the 'Active Sessions' section will show you all the devices and locations currently logged into your account. You can also log out of other sessions from there.

question: How do I create a new project?
answer: To create a new project, navigate to your Dashboard and click the 'Create New Project' button. You will be guided through setting up the project name, description, and other details.

question: Where do I go to start a new project?
answer: You can start a new project directly from your main Dashboard. Look for the prominent 'Create New Project' button, usually located in the top-right corner.

question: What's the process for setting up a project?
answer: To set up a project, click 'Create New Project' on your Dashboard. You'll need to provide a title, a brief description, and you can optionally set a start and end date and invite members right away.

question: Help me make a new project.
answer: Certainly! To create a new project, just go to your Dashboard and find the 'Create New Project' button. The platform will then guide you through the necessary steps.

question: How do I find a project I'm a member of?
answer: All projects you are a member of are listed on your main Dashboard under a 'My Projects' section. You can also use the search bar at the top of the page to search for a project by its name.

question: I can't find my project.
answer: If you can't see your project on the dashboard, make sure you haven't archived it. You can also try searching for its name using the global search bar. If you were invited, check your email for an invitation link.

question: Where is the list of my projects?
answer: The list of all your active projects is the main feature of your dashboard, which is the first screen you see after logging in.

question: Can I edit the project details after creation?
answer: Yes, if you are a project admin or the creator, you can edit project details at any time. Go to the project's main page and find the 'Project Settings' or 'Edit Project' option.

question: How to change a project's name?
answer: To change a project's name, you need admin permissions for that project. Go to 'Project Settings' -> 'General' and you will find the option to edit the project title.

question: How to update the project description?
answer: The project description can be updated in 'Project Settings'. As a project admin, you can navigate there and find the description field to make your edits.

question: How do I archive a completed project?
answer: To archive a project, go to its 'Project Settings' page and look for the 'Archive Project' option. Archiving will remove it from your main dashboard but keep all data for future reference.

question: What happens when I archive a project?
answer: Archiving a project moves it to a separate 'Archived' section, removing it from your active dashboard. All project data, including files, tasks, and discussions, is saved and can be accessed or restored later.

question: Should I archive or delete a project?
answer: You should archive a project if you are finished with it but may want to access its data in the future. You should only delete a project if you are absolutely sure you will never need its contents again, as deletion is permanent.

question: Where can I find my archived projects?
answer: You can view your archived projects by clicking on your profile icon in the top navigation bar and selecting 'View Archived Projects' or a similar option from the dropdown menu.

question: How to see projects that are finished?
answer: Finished projects that you've archived can be found in the 'Archived Projects' section, which is accessible from your main account menu.

question: Can I restore an archived project?
answer: Yes, you can easily restore an archived project. Find the project in your 'Archived Projects' list and click the 'Restore' or 'Unarchive' button. It will reappear on your main dashboard.

question: How to unarchive a project?
answer: To unarchive a project, go to your list of archived projects, find the one you want to bring back, and click the 'Restore' button.

question: How do I delete a project permanently?
answer: To permanently delete a project, you must first archive it. Then, from the 'Archived Projects' list, you will have the option to delete it forever. This action is irreversible and will delete all associated data, so please be certain.

question: Is deleting a project permanent?
answer: Yes, deleting a project is a permanent action and cannot be undone. All tasks, files, and discussions associated with it will be permanently erased. If you might need the data later, we recommend archiving it instead.

question: How do I set a deadline for a project?
answer: Project deadlines can be set during creation or edited later in 'Project Settings'. This master deadline will be visible to all project members on the project dashboard and calendar.

question: Can I change a project's due date?
answer: Yes, the project's overall due date can be changed at any time by a project admin in the 'Project Settings' section.

question: What is a project dashboard?
answer: The project dashboard is the main page for each individual project. It provides an 'at-a-glance' overview of recent activity, upcoming task deadlines, key files, team members, and overall progress.

question: How to see a project summary?
answer: The best place to see a project summary is the project's dashboard. It shows you the latest updates, who is working on what, and how close you are to important deadlines.

question: How do I check the progress of my project?
answer: The project dashboard provides a progress bar or percentage completion based on the number of tasks completed versus the total number of tasks. You can also view the activity feed to see recent updates.

question: How can I see how much of the project is done?
answer: Look for the progress meter on the project dashboard. It calculates the percentage of tasks that have been marked as complete.

question: Can I see a calendar view of my project?
answer: Yes, most projects have a 'Calendar' view. This will show all tasks with due dates plotted on a monthly calendar, giving you a clear overview of your schedule.

question: Is there a Gantt chart view?
answer: Yes, for projects that require detailed timeline planning, a Gantt chart view is available. You can access it from the view switcher in the 'Tasks' section. It visualizes task durations, dependencies, and your project's critical path.

question: Can I duplicate a project?
answer: Yes, you can duplicate or clone an existing project to use as a template. In 'Project Settings', look for a 'Duplicate Project' or 'Clone' option. This will copy the project structure, tasks, and file folders, but not the comments or member-specific data.

question: How to copy a project?
answer: To copy a project, go to the settings of the project you want to copy and select 'Duplicate Project'. This is useful for creating a new project with the same structure.

question: How do I add a project to my favorites?
answer: To add a project to your favorites for quick access, go to the project's dashboard and look for a star icon near the project title. Clicking it will add the project to a 'Favorites' section on your main dashboard.

question: How can I pin a project to my dashboard?
answer: You can 'pin' a project by marking it as a favorite. Find the star icon on the project's page. This will keep it in a special 'Favorites' area at the top of your main dashboard.

question: Can I assign a color to my project?
answer: Yes, you can assign a color to your project for better organization on your dashboard. In 'Project Settings', you should find a color picker option to help you visually distinguish between your projects.

question: How can I add members to my project?
answer: Inside your project, go to the 'Members' or 'Team' tab and click 'Invite Member'. You can then search for users by their name or university email address and send them an invitation.

question: How do I invite someone to my project?
answer: To invite someone, open the project, navigate to the 'Members' tab, and use the 'Invite Member' button. You can invite them by entering their university email.

question: Where is the invite button?
answer: The 'Invite Member' button is located in the 'Members' or 'Team' section within each of your projects. You must be an admin of the project to see this button.

question: How to get my friend to join my project?
answer: To get your friend to join, go to the 'Members' tab in the project, click 'Invite Member', and enter their university email address. They will receive an email with a link to join.

question: Can I invite people from outside my university?
answer: Currently, SynKro is designed for collaboration within your institution. All members must have a valid university email address from a partner school to join a project.

question: Can I add my friend from another college?
answer: Unfortunately, no. SynKro access is restricted to users within the same institutional network. Your friend would need to have an email address from your university to be invited.

question: What are the different roles in a project?
answer: Projects typically have three main roles: 'Admin' (can manage settings, billing, and members), 'Member' (can create and edit tasks, files, and discussions), and 'Viewer' (can only view project content, cannot make changes).

question: What's the difference between an admin and a member?
answer: A 'Member' can actively work on the project (e.g., complete tasks, upload files). An 'Admin' has all member permissions, plus the ability to manage project settings, add or remove other members, and archive or delete the project.

question: What can a 'Viewer' do?
answer: A 'Viewer' has read-only access. They can look at all the tasks, files, and discussions in a project, but they cannot edit, create, or delete anything. It's a good role for stakeholders or advisors who need to stay informed.

question: How do I change a member's role?
answer: As a project admin, go to the 'Members' tab, find the member you want to change, and use the dropdown menu next to their name to select a new role (e.g., change from 'Member' to 'Admin').

question: How do I make someone a project admin?
answer: To make a member an admin, go to the 'Members' tab, find the user, and change their role to 'Admin' using the role selector next to their name. You must be an admin yourself to do this.

question: How to give someone more permissions?
answer: To give a member more permissions, you can change their role to 'Admin'. This can be done by a current admin from the 'Members' page of the project.

question: How to remove a member from a project?
answer: As a project admin, you can remove a member by going to the 'Members' tab. Click the options menu (usually three dots) next to the member's name and select 'Remove from Project'.

question: How do I kick someone from my project?
answer: To remove someone from your project, go to the 'Members' list, find the person you want to remove, and use the options menu to select 'Remove from Project'. This will revoke their access immediately.

question: What happens if I remove a member?
answer: When you remove a member, they immediately lose all access to the project. Their previously assigned tasks become unassigned, but any files they uploaded or messages they sent will remain in the project.

question: How do I see all the members of a project?
answer: You can see a full list of project members, along with their roles, by clicking on the 'Members' or 'Team' tab within the project.

question: Who is on my team?
answer: To see who is on your team for a specific project, just click on the 'Members' tab inside that project.

question: How do I leave a project?
answer: To leave a project you are a member of, go to the 'Members' tab. Find your own name in the list, click the options menu (...), and select 'Leave Project'.

question: I want to remove myself from a project.
answer: You can remove yourself from a project by navigating to its 'Members' page, finding your name, and choosing the 'Leave Project' option from the associated menu.

question: What happens when I leave a project?
answer: When you leave a project, your access to its content is immediately revoked. Any tasks assigned to you will become unassigned, but the files you uploaded and messages you sent will remain for the rest of the team.

question: My invitation to a project expired.
answer: Project invitations expire after a certain period for security. Please ask the project admin to send you a new invitation.

question: The invite link isn't working.
answer: If an invitation link isn't working, it may have expired or been revoked. The best course of action is to contact the person who invited you and request a fresh invitation.

question: How do I create a new task?
answer: In the 'Tasks' or 'Task Board' section of your project, click the 'Add Task' or '+' button. You can then provide a title, description, assign it to a team member, and set a due date.

question: Where can I add a task?
answer: Tasks are managed within each project. Go to your project and click on the 'Tasks' or 'Task Board' tab to add a new task.

question: How to make a to-do item?
answer: To make a to-do item, which we call a 'task', go to the 'Tasks' section of your project and click 'Add Task'.

question: How do I assign a task to someone?
answer: When creating or editing a task, you'll see an 'Assignee' or 'Assign to' field. Click it and select the project member you want to assign the task to from the list.

question: How to give a task to a team member?
answer: You can give a task to a team member by 'assigning' it to them. Open the task details, click on the 'Assignee' field, and choose their name from the list.

question: Can I assign a task to multiple people?
answer: Yes, our task management system supports assigning a single task to multiple team members. In the 'Assignee' field, you should be able to select more than one person.

question: How to assign one task to the whole group?
answer: Yes, you can assign a task to the whole group. When you click the 'Assignee' field, you should be able to select multiple names or sometimes even an option for 'All Members'.

question: How do I set a due date for a task?
answer: In the task creation or edit view, there is a 'Due Date' field. Click it to open a calendar and select the date the task should be completed by.

question: How to change a task's deadline?
answer: To change a task's deadline, simply click on the task to open its details, then click on the current due date to select a new one from the calendar.

question: Can a task have a start date and an end date?
answer: Yes. In the task details, you can set both a 'Start Date' and a 'Due Date' to define a specific work period for that task. This is especially useful in the Gantt chart and Calendar views.

question: How do I mark a task as complete?
answer: To mark a task as complete, simply click the checkbox next to the task's name in the list or board view. You can also open the task and change its status to 'Done' or 'Completed'.

question: How do I finish a task?
answer: When you've finished a task, you can mark it as 'Done' by checking the box next to its title. This will move it to the completed section and notify relevant team members.

question: What happens when I complete a task?
answer: When you complete a task, it's typically moved from the 'In Progress' list to the 'Done' list. The project's overall progress meter will update, and any tasks that were dependent on it may become unblocked.

question: How do I reopen a completed task?
answer: You can reopen a completed task by finding it in the 'Completed' tasks list and unchecking the checkbox, or by opening it and changing its status back to 'To Do' or 'In Progress'.

question: How do I view all my assigned tasks?
answer: On your main dashboard, there is a 'My Tasks' widget that shows all tasks assigned to you across all your projects. You can also filter by 'Assigned to me' within any project's task board.

question: Where can I see the work assigned to me?
answer: The 'My Tasks' section on your main dashboard is the best place to see a consolidated list of all tasks assigned to you from every project you're a part of.

question: What are subtasks?
answer: Subtasks are smaller, manageable steps within a larger parent task. They are perfect for breaking down complex work into a checklist of items that can be tracked individually.

question: How do I add a subtask?
answer: Open the detail view of the parent task you want to add a subtask to. You will find an 'Add Subtask' or 'Add Checklist Item' button or field where you can list out the smaller steps.

question: Can I assign a subtask to a different person?
answer: Yes, subtasks can be assigned to different people than the parent task. Each subtask has its own assignee field, allowing you to delegate small parts of a larger task.

question: Can I reorder tasks?
answer: Yes, in the 'Task Board' or 'List' view, you can typically drag and drop tasks to reorder them or move them between columns (e.g., from 'To Do' to 'In Progress').

question: How to prioritize tasks?
answer: You can prioritize tasks by dragging and dropping them into the desired order in the list view. You can also use priority tags (e.g., High, Medium, Low) if your project has them enabled.

question: How can I filter tasks?
answer: The task view includes powerful filter options, usually at the top of the page. You can filter tasks by assignee, due date, tags, status, or keywords to quickly find what you're looking for.

question: How to find a specific task?
answer: To find a specific task, you can use the search bar within the 'Tasks' section of a project. You can also use filters to narrow down the list by who it's assigned to or its status.

question: How do I attach a file to a task?
answer: When you are creating or editing a task, look for an 'Attach File' or paperclip icon. This allows you to upload a file from your computer or link to a file in the project's main file repository, directly associating it with that task.

question: Can I comment on a task?
answer: Yes, every task has its own comment thread. Open the task details to view and add comments. This is a great way to ask questions or provide updates about that specific piece of work.

question: How to discuss a specific task?
answer: The best way to discuss a task is by using the comments section within that task. Click on the task to open it, and you'll find a space to add comments and @mention team members.

question: What is a Kanban board?
answer: A Kanban board is a visual way to manage tasks, represented as cards in columns like 'To Do', 'In Progress', and 'Done'. You can see your project's tasks on a Kanban board by selecting the 'Board' view in the 'Tasks' section.

question: How to see my tasks in a board view?
answer: In the 'Tasks' section of your project, look for a view switcher, often with icons for 'List', 'Board', and 'Calendar'. Click on 'Board' to see your tasks organized in columns.

question: How do I move a task from 'To Do' to 'In Progress'?
answer: In the 'Board' view, you can simply drag the task card from the 'To Do' column and drop it into the 'In Progress' column. This will also update the task's status.

question: What are task dependencies?
answer: Task dependencies allow you to link tasks together. For example, you can mark Task B as 'blocked by' Task A. This means Task B cannot be started until Task A is completed, helping to manage workflows.

question: How do I set a task dependency?
answer: When editing a task, look for a 'Dependencies' or 'Blocking' section. There, you can search for another task and mark the current task as being blocked by it, or vice versa.

question: How to link two tasks together?
answer: You can link tasks by setting up dependencies. Open one task, go to its dependency settings, and choose the other task it is related to (e.g., 'Task 2 is blocked by Task 1').

question: Can I see a list of all my completed tasks?
answer: Yes, in the 'Tasks' section, you can filter the view to show 'Completed' tasks. There is usually a filter or a tab to switch between viewing active and completed items.

question: Where do my finished tasks go?
answer: Finished tasks are moved to a 'Completed' or 'Done' list. They are hidden from the main active task view but can be accessed by changing your filter settings to show completed items.

question: Can I add tags or labels to tasks?
answer: Yes, you can add tags or labels to tasks to help categorize them (e.g., 'bug', 'research', 'design'). When creating or editing a task, look for a 'Tags' or 'Labels' field. You can then filter your task board by these tags.

question: How to label a task?
answer: To label a task, open its details and find the 'Labels' or 'Tags' field. You can then select from existing labels or create a new one to help organize your work.

question: Can I create recurring tasks?
answer: Yes, you can set tasks to recur on a regular schedule (e.g., daily, weekly, monthly). When creating a task, look for a 'Repeat' or 'Recurrence' option to set the schedule.

question: How do I make a task repeat every week?
answer: To make a task repeat, open the task details and find the 'Repeat' or 'Recurrence' settings. You can then choose 'Weekly' and select the day of the week for it to recur.

question: How can I see all tasks in a project, not just mine?
answer: By default, the 'Tasks' section shows all tasks for the project. If your view is filtered, look for a 'Filters' button and select 'Clear Filters' or set the 'Assignee' filter to 'Anyone' to see all tasks.

question: I only see my tasks, how do I see everyone's?
answer: You are likely in a 'My Tasks' view or have a filter applied. Go to the main 'Tasks' tab for the project and make sure the 'Assignee' filter is set to 'Anyone' or 'All'.

question: How do I upload a file to a project?
answer: Navigate to the 'Files' or 'Documents' tab within your project. You can either drag and drop your files directly into the window or use the 'Upload File' button to select them from your computer.

question: Where do I put my project files?
answer: All project-related files should be uploaded to the 'Files' section of that specific project. This keeps everything organized and accessible to all team members.

question: How to add a document?
answer: To add a document, go to the 'Files' tab in your project and click the 'Upload' button. You can then choose the document from your computer to add it to the project.

question: What is the maximum file size I can upload?
answer: The maximum file size for a single upload is 100MB. For larger files, we recommend sharing a link from a cloud storage service like Google Drive or Dropbox and posting the link in the project's discussion area.

question: My file is too big to upload, what do I do?
answer: If your file is over the 100MB limit, the best solution is to upload it to a cloud service like Google Drive, Dropbox, or OneDrive, and then share the link to the file in a task or discussion in SynKro.

question: How do I organize files?
answer: Within the 'Files' tab, you can create folders to organize your documents just like on your computer. Click 'Create Folder' to add a new folder and then you can drag and drop files into it.

question: How to create a folder for files?
answer: In the project's 'Files' section, look for a 'Create Folder' or 'New Folder' button. This will let you name a new folder, which you can then use to organize your project files.

question: How do I move a file to a different folder?
answer: You can move a file by dragging and dropping it onto the desired folder in the 'Files' view. Alternatively, you can click the options menu on the file and select 'Move', then choose the destination folder.

question: How do I download a file?
answer: To download a file, navigate to the 'Files' tab, find the file you need, and click the download icon next to it. You can also select multiple files and download them together as a single .zip archive.

question: How to save a file to my computer?
answer: Find the file you want to save in the 'Files' section of the project. Click the download button (usually a downward arrow icon) to save it to your computer.

question: Can I download all project files at once?
answer: Yes, you can download all files in a project or a specific folder at once. Select the files or folder you want, and look for a 'Download' option. They will be compressed into a single .zip file for you.

question: Does SynKro support file versioning?
answer: Yes, when you upload a new version of a file with the same name, SynKro automatically keeps the previous versions. This allows you to view or restore older versions from the file's detail page, preventing accidental data loss.

question: How to see previous versions of a file?
answer: Click on the file to open its detail view. If multiple versions exist, you will see a 'Version History' or 'Revisions' tab where you can view, compare, and download older versions of the file.

question: Can I restore an old version of a file?
answer: Yes. In the file's 'Version History', you can select an older version and choose to 'Restore' it, making it the current version for the project.

question: How do I delete a file?
answer: To delete a file, go to the 'Files' tab, find the file, and click the 'Delete' or trash can icon. You may need specific permissions (like being the uploader or a project admin) to delete certain files.

question: I accidentally deleted a file, can I get it back?
answer: Deleted files are usually moved to a 'Trash' folder for a period of time (e.g., 30 days) before being permanently erased. Check the 'Trash' within the 'Files' section to see if you can restore it.

question: Can I preview files in the browser?
answer: Yes, SynKro supports in-browser previews for many common file types like PDF, images (JPG, PNG, GIF), and text documents. Just click on the file name to open the previewer without needing to download it.

question: Why can't I preview my file?
answer: The in-browser previewer supports common file types like PDFs, images, and text files. If your file is a specialized format (e.g., a Photoshop .psd file, a CAD drawing), you will need to download it and open it with the appropriate software.

question: How to search for a file?
answer: In the 'Files' tab of your project, there is a search bar at the top. You can use it to search for files by their name. Some advanced plans also support searching within the content of the documents.

question: Can I link to files from Google Drive?
answer: Yes, you can integrate your Google Drive account. This allows you to attach files from your Google Drive directly to tasks or discussions without having to upload them to SynKro's storage.

question: How do I connect my Dropbox account?
answer: To connect your Dropbox account, go to 'Account Settings' -> 'Integrations'. You will find an option to link Dropbox, which will authorize SynKro to access your files for easy sharing.

question: How do I rename a file?
answer: To rename a file, navigate to it in the 'Files' list, click the options menu (three dots) next to the file name, and select the 'Rename' option.

question: Is there a limit to how many files I can store?
answer: Each project comes with a generous storage allowance, typically several gigabytes. If you approach the limit, the project admin will be notified. For very large files, linking from a service like Google Drive is recommended.

question: How do I send a message to a team member?
answer: You can use the main 'Chat' feature in the top navigation bar to send a direct message (DM) to any user in your network. You can also @mention them in a project's discussion forum for project-specific talk.

question: How to DM someone?
answer: To send a Direct Message (DM), click on the 'Chat' icon in the global navigation bar, search for the user you want to talk to, and start the conversation.

question: Is there a chat for each project?
answer: Yes, every project has its own dedicated 'Discussion' or 'Forum' tab. This is the best place for project-specific conversations to keep them organized and accessible to all team members.

question: Where is the group chat for my project?
answer: The group chat for your project is in the 'Discussion' section. You can access it by opening the project and clicking on the 'Discussion' tab.

question: How do I use the discussion forum?
answer: Navigate to the 'Discussion' tab in your project. You can start a new topic by clicking 'New Post' or reply to existing conversations in a threaded format. It supports text formatting, @mentions, and file attachments.

question: How to start a new conversation in a project?
answer: To start a new conversation, go to the project's 'Discussion' tab and click the 'Start New Discussion' or 'New Post' button.

question: What is an @mention?
answer: An @mention is a way to directly notify a specific user in a conversation. Simply type the '@' symbol followed by their name (e.g., @JaneDoe). They will receive a specific notification that you mentioned them, drawing their attention to your message.

question: How do I get someone's attention in a discussion?
answer: The best way to get a specific person's attention is to @mention them in your comment. Type '@' and then start typing their name to select them from a list. This sends them a direct notification.

question: How to tag a person in a comment?
answer: To tag someone, use the '@' symbol followed by their username. As you type, a list of project members will appear for you to choose from.

question: What are announcements?
answer: Announcements are special, high-priority messages sent by project admins or faculty to all members of a project. They typically appear as a banner at the top of the project dashboard and often trigger an email notification to ensure everyone sees them.

question: How do I post an announcement?
answer: If you are a project admin, go to the project dashboard. You should see a section or button labeled 'Post Announcement' or 'Create Announcement'. This feature is restricted to admins to prevent spam.

question: Can I edit a message I sent?
answer: Yes, for a short period after sending, you can typically edit your own messages in chat and discussions. Hover over your message and look for an 'Edit' icon or option in the menu.

question: I made a typo, can I fix my message?
answer: Yes, you can fix typos by editing your message. Hover over the message you sent and select the 'Edit' option to correct it.

question: Can I delete a message?
answer: Yes, you can usually delete your own messages. Hover over the message and look for a 'Delete' or trash can icon. Note that in some official course projects, deletion may be disabled by the faculty administrator.

question: How to unsend a message?
answer: You can 'unsend' a message by deleting it. Hover over the message you want to remove and select the 'Delete' option. This will remove it from the conversation for everyone.

question: Are my direct messages private?
answer: Yes, direct messages (DMs) between you and another user are private and cannot be seen by other users or project administrators.

question: Can my professor read my DMs?
answer: No, your direct messages are private. Professors and administrators cannot read your one-on-one chats. They can only see public discussions within the projects they oversee.

question: Can I use emojis in my messages?
answer: Yes, of course! Our chat and discussion forums fully support emojis. You can use your computer's native emoji picker or type common emoji codes like :)

question: How to add a smiley face?
answer: You can add a smiley face and other emojis using your device's built-in emoji keyboard, or by typing common shortcuts like :-) or :D.

question: Can I format my text, like bold or italics?
answer: Yes, our discussion forums support Markdown for text formatting. You can use asterisks for *italics* and double asterisks for **bold** text, as well as create lists and headers.

question: How to make text bold?
answer: To make text bold, wrap it in double asterisks. For example, `**this text will be bold**`.

question: How do I know if someone read my message?
answer: In direct messages, SynKro supports read receipts, similar to other messaging apps. You will see a small icon or text indicating that the recipient has seen your message. This may not be available in larger project discussions.

question: Can I search my chat history?
answer: Yes, within a chat conversation or a project discussion, there is a search bar that allows you to search for keywords within that specific conversation's history.

question: How can I view the progress of all student projects?
answer: As a faculty member, your main dashboard includes a 'Faculty Overview' or 'Instructor Dashboard' panel. From there, you can select a course or project group to view high-level statistics, progress reports, and activity feeds for all associated projects.

question: Where is the faculty dashboard?
answer: The faculty-specific tools are integrated directly into your main dashboard. Look for a 'Faculty Overview' or 'Instructor View' section, which provides access to course management, student analytics, and reporting tools.

question: How do I create a project template for my class?
answer: You can create a standard project and set it up with required tasks, folder structures, and resource files. Then, in the 'Project Settings', you'll find an option to 'Save as Template'. Your students can then select this template when they create their own projects for the assignment.

question: Can I make a template for my students?
answer: Yes, absolutely. Create a project exactly as you want it for your students, including any starter tasks or files. Then, go into its 'Project Settings' and choose 'Save as Template'. This makes it available for your students to use.

question: How can I reuse a project setup for multiple teams?
answer: The best way to reuse a project setup is to create a 'Project Template'. Set up one project perfectly, then save it as a template from the project settings. Each team can then start their work from your template.

question: How can I grade a project?
answer: SynKro is designed to supplement your university's official Learning Management System (LMS), not replace its grading functions. Within a project, you'll find a 'Grade in LMS' button that will provide a direct link to the corresponding gradebook entry in your LMS (like Canvas, Blackboard, or Moodle).

question: Does SynKro connect to Canvas?
answer: Yes, SynKro offers integration with major Learning Management Systems, including Canvas. This allows for seamless roster synchronization and links for grading directly back to your Canvas gradebook.

question: Can I see a student's individual contribution?
answer: Yes, the 'Project Analytics' or 'Reports' tab for each project provides insights into member activity. You can see statistics on task completions, file uploads, and discussion participation, which helps in gauging individual contributions to the group effort.

question: How to tell what each student did?
answer: To see what each student has done, go to the 'Project Analytics' section. It provides a breakdown of activity by user, showing you who completed which tasks, uploaded which files, and contributed to discussions.

question: Is there a report on student activity?
answer: Yes, for each project, you can access an 'Activity Report' or 'Analytics' page that details the contributions of each team member.

question: How do I track deadlines for all teams?
answer: The 'Faculty Overview' on your dashboard provides a master calendar or timeline view. This shows all key project and task deadlines for the projects you oversee, often color-coded by team or course for easy tracking.

question: Can I see all my students' deadlines in one place?
answer: Yes, the master calendar on your faculty dashboard consolidates all project and task deadlines from all the student teams you are supervising into a single view.

question: How can I send an announcement to all my students?
answer: From your 'Faculty Overview' dashboard, you can create a global announcement. You will have the option to send it to all students in a specific course or to all projects you supervise simultaneously.

question: How to message an entire class?
answer: The best way to message an entire class is to use the 'Create Announcement' feature from your 'Faculty Dashboard'. This will broadcast your message to all students in the selected course.

question: Can I bulk-create projects for student groups?
answer: Yes, in the 'Faculty Tools' section, there is a 'Bulk Project Creation' feature. You can upload a CSV file with team names and member emails to automatically generate all the projects and invite the students in one step.

question: How to set up groups automatically?
answer: You can set up all your student groups automatically using the 'Bulk Project Creation' tool. Prepare a CSV file containing the project names and the email addresses of the students in each group, then upload it through the tool on your faculty dashboard.

question: Can I access a student's project without being a member?
answer: Yes. As a faculty member supervising a course, you have oversight access to all projects created for that course. You do not need a direct invitation from the students to view their work and progress.

question: Do I need students to invite me to see their project?
answer: No. If the projects are part of a course you are teaching, you automatically have supervisor access to view them. You do not need an invitation from the students.

question: Can I export data from a project?
answer: As a faculty member or project admin, you have the option to export project data. In 'Project Settings', look for an 'Export' option. This typically allows you to download task lists as CSV and a summary report as a PDF.

question: How to get a report of a project?
answer: You can generate a report for a project by going to its 'Reports' or 'Analytics' section. There is also usually an 'Export to PDF' option for creating a shareable summary document.

question: Can I set specific permissions for a project template?
answer: When you create a project template, the roles and default permissions are copied. You can set up the template with specific roles (e.g., pre-defined 'Designer', 'Researcher' roles with certain permissions) that will be applied when a new project is created from it.

question: The platform is running slow, what should I do?
answer: If you experience slowness, please try clearing your browser cache and cookies first, as this often resolves the issue. If the problem persists, check our 'System Status' page (link in the footer) for any ongoing incidents, or contact our support team to report the problem.

question: Why is SynKro so slow right now?
answer: Performance issues can sometimes be caused by your local browser cache. Please try clearing your cache and reloading the page. If that doesn't help, there might be a wider issue. You can check our 'System Status' page or contact support for more information.

question: The page is taking a long time to load.
answer: If a page is loading slowly, first try a hard refresh (Ctrl+Shift+R or Cmd+Shift+R). If it's still slow, clearing your browser's cache is the next best step. If the issue affects multiple pages, please check our System Status page.

question: SynKro is not loading
answer: If the platform isn't loading, first check your internet connection. Then, try a different web browser or clear your current browser's cache. You can also visit our official 'System Status' page to see if we are experiencing a service outage.

question: Is the site down?
answer: To check if our services are operational, please visit the 'System Status' page, usually linked in the footer of our website. This page provides real-time information on any outages or performance degradation.

question: I'm getting a white screen.
answer: A white or blank screen usually indicates a problem loading the application's resources. The best first step is to clear your browser's cache and cookies and then try reloading the page. If that doesn't work, please try a different browser to see if the issue is isolated.

question: How do I report a bug?
answer: You can report a bug by clicking the 'Help' menu and selecting 'Report an Issue'. Please provide as much detail as possible, including what you were doing, what you expected to happen, and what actually happened. Screenshots are also very helpful!

question: Something is broken, who do I tell?
answer: If you've found something broken, we'd appreciate you letting us know! Please use the 'Report an Issue' form in the 'Help' menu to send a bug report directly to our technical team.

question: I found a glitch.
answer: Thank you for finding it! The best way to let us know is to use the 'Report an Issue' option in the 'Help' menu. Please describe the glitch in as much detail as you can.

question: Which browsers are supported?
answer: SynKro is optimized for the latest versions of Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, Safari, and Microsoft Edge. We do not recommend using Internet Explorer as some features may not work correctly.

question: Does SynKro work on my phone?
answer: Yes, the SynKro web application is fully responsive and designed to work on modern mobile browsers on both iOS and Android devices. While we don't have a native app yet, the web experience is optimized for mobile use.

question: I can't upload a file.
answer: If you're having trouble uploading a file, please check three things first: 1) Is the file larger than the 100MB size limit? 2) Is your internet connection stable? 3) Is the file type supported? If you're still having issues, please contact support.

question: My file upload failed.
answer: A file upload can fail due to its size (over 100MB), a temporary internet issue, or an unsupported file format. Please verify these and try again. If the problem continues, our support team can help investigate.

question: The upload is stuck at 99%.
answer: If an upload gets stuck, it's almost always a network connection issue. Please try canceling the upload and starting it again. If you're on a spotty Wi-Fi connection, moving to a more stable one might help.

question: How do I clear my browser cache?
answer: The process for clearing your browser cache varies by browser. Generally, you can find the option in the 'Settings' or 'History' menu under a section called 'Clear Browsing Data'. A quick web search for 'clear cache' plus your browser's name (e.g., 'clear cache chrome') will give you detailed instructions.

question: I am seeing a 500 error, what does it mean?
answer: A '500 Internal Server Error' means that something went wrong on our servers. Our technical team is automatically notified of these errors, but we would appreciate it if you could also report the issue via the 'Help' menu, describing what you were trying to do when it happened.

question: I'm getting a 404 error
answer: A '404 Not Found' error means the page you are trying to access does not exist. Please double-check the URL for any typos. If you clicked a link within the platform that led to this error, please report it as a bug so we can fix it.

question: I'm getting a 403 error
answer: A '403 Forbidden' error means you do not have permission to view the page you are trying to access. This is usually because you are not a member of that project or do not have the required role. If you believe you should have access, please contact the project's administrator.

question: I can't see the 'delete' button.
answer: If you can't see a 'delete' button for an item (like a project or file), it's likely a permissions issue. Usually, only the creator of an item or a project administrator has the permission to delete it.

question: Where can I provide feedback about the platform?
answer: We'd love to hear your feedback! You can use the 'Send Feedback' or 'Suggest a Feature' option in the 'Help' menu to share your ideas for improving SynKro.

question: Is my data secure on SynKro?
answer: Yes, security is our top priority. All data is encrypted in transit (using TLS/SSL) and at rest. We follow industry best practices for application security and perform regular audits to protect your information.

question: Is my work safe here?
answer: Absolutely. We take numerous measures to ensure your work is safe. This includes using strong encryption, maintaining secure server infrastructure, and providing you with robust privacy controls over who can see your projects.

question: How is my data encrypted?
answer: Your data is protected with multiple layers of encryption. We use TLS 1.2 or higher for data in transit between your device and our servers, and industry-standard AES-256 encryption for data at rest on our servers.

question: Who can see my project data?
answer: Your project data is only visible to the members of that specific project and any authorized faculty supervisors for your course. We do not share your project data with third parties. For more details, please review our Privacy Policy.

question: Can other students see my work?
answer: Only students who are members of your project team can see your work. Students from other teams or courses cannot access your project's files, tasks, or discussions.

question: Can SynKro employees see my data?
answer: Access to user data by SynKro employees is strictly limited to a small number of authorized personnel for the purposes of technical support and system maintenance. All access is logged and audited.

question: Where can I find the privacy policy?
answer: You can find a link to our full Privacy Policy in the footer of every page on the SynKro platform. We encourage you to read it to understand how we handle your data.

question: How do you handle my data?
answer: We handle your data in accordance with our Privacy Policy and relevant regulations like GDPR and FERPA. Your data is used to provide and improve the service, and it is not sold to third parties. All project content belongs to you and your institution.

question: Is this platform FERPA compliant?
answer: Yes, we are committed to protecting student data and are compliant with the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA).

question: How to enable two-factor authentication?
answer: For enhanced security, you can enable Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) in your 'Account Settings' under the 'Security' tab. You will need an authenticator app on your phone (like Google Authenticator or Authy) to complete the setup.

question: How do I make my account more secure?
answer: The best way to enhance your account's security is by enabling Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) in your 'Account Settings'. Using a strong, unique password that you don't reuse on other sites is also highly recommended.

question: What is 2FA?
answer: 2FA, or Two-Factor Authentication, adds an extra layer of security to your account. After you enter your password, you'll also need to provide a second piece of informationusually a temporary code from an authenticator app on your phoneto log in.

question: Which authenticator apps are supported?
answer: Our Two-Factor Authentication system supports any standard TOTP (Time-based One-Time Password) authenticator app, including Google Authenticator, Microsoft Authenticator, Authy, and password managers like 1Password or Bitwarden.

question: What happens to my data if my university's subscription ends?
answer: If your institution's partnership with SynKro ends, you will be given a grace period (e.g., 30-60 days) during which you can export your project data. After this period, the data will be archived and eventually deleted in accordance with our data retention policy.

question: What happens to my projects after I graduate?
answer: Your access to SynKro is tied to your university account. After you graduate and your university email is deactivated, you will lose access. We recommend exporting any important project data before you lose access.

question: Who made you?
answer: I am SynKro Assist, an AI-powered chatbot developed by the SynKro team to help users like you get the most out of our platform.

question: Are you a human?
answer: I am not a human. I am an AI assistant designed to provide information and support for the SynKro platform. If you need to speak with a human, I can help you contact our support team.

question: How can I contact support?
answer: You can contact our human support team by using the 'Contact Support' option in the 'Help' menu. This will allow you to submit a ticket with your question.

question: I need to talk to a person.
answer: I understand. To talk to a person from our support team, please click on the 'Help' menu and choose 'Contact Support' to create a support request.

question: What is your name?
answer: You can call me SynKro Assist. I'm here to help!

question: What are the password requirements?
answer: For your security, passwords must be at least 12 characters long and include a mix of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers, and symbols.

question: Can I see an activity log for my project?
answer: Yes, every project has an 'Activity' feed or 'Audit Log' that shows a chronological list of all actions taken within the project, such as task completions, file uploads, and new comments.

question: Can I assign a task to someone who is not in the project?
answer: No, you can only assign tasks to users who are already members of the project. You would need to invite them to the project first before you can assign them any work.

question: What file types can be previewed?
answer: Our in-browser previewer supports most common file types, including PDF, .doc, .docx, .xls, .xlsx, .ppt, .pptx, and image files like .jpg, .png, and .gif.

question: Can I create a group chat with specific people?
answer: Yes, you can create a private group chat. In the main 'Chat' section, you can start a new conversation and add multiple users to it. This chat will be separate from any project-specific discussions.

question: Can I lock a project after the deadline?
answer: Yes, as a faculty member, you can 'lock' a project after its submission deadline. This makes the project read-only for students, preventing any further changes while you conduct your grading.

question: Is there a desktop app for SynKro?
answer: Currently, we offer a full-featured web application that works on all modern browsers. A dedicated desktop application for Windows and macOS is on our development roadmap.

question: How do I report a security vulnerability?
answer: If you believe you have discovered a security vulnerability, please do not disclose it publicly. Contact us directly via our responsible disclosure program, detailed on our 'Security' page, or by emailing security@synkro.edu.

question: I did not receive the verification email.
answer: If you did not receive a verification email after signing up, please check your spam or junk folder first. If it's not there, you can request a new verification link from the login page.

question: How many projects can I create?
answer: Under our standard university plan, there is no limit to the number of projects you can create or be a member of. Feel free to create as many as you need for your coursework.

question: Can I export my tasks to a calendar app?
answer: Yes, you can subscribe to your personal SynKro task calendar from external calendar apps like Google Calendar or Apple Calendar. Look for the 'Calendar Sync' or 'Subscribe' link in the 'My Tasks' or calendar section.

question: Can I comment directly on a file?
answer: Yes, you can comment on files. When you preview a file, you'll see a comment panel where you can have a discussion with your team specifically about that document.

question: Can I star or save important messages?
answer: Yes, you can 'star' or 'pin' important messages in discussions or chats to easily find them later. Hover over a message and look for a star icon.

question: How do I see which teams haven't started their project?
answer: Your faculty dashboard provides an overview of project activity. You can quickly see which projects have had no recent activity or have zero tasks created, which is a good indicator that a team has not yet started.

question: The text on the site is too small. How can I make it bigger?
answer: You can easily make the text bigger by using your browser's built-in zoom function. Press 'Ctrl' and '+' (or 'Cmd' and '+') to zoom in, and 'Ctrl' and '-' (or 'Cmd' and '-') to zoom out.

question: Where is my data stored?
answer: Your data is stored securely on cloud servers located in a specific geographic region, chosen in compliance with your institution's data residency requirements. For details, refer to our data policy or your university's IT guidelines.

question: What happens if I change my major?
answer: Changing your major in real life won't affect your SynKro account, but you can update your profile to reflect it! Just go to your 'Profile' page and click 'Edit Profile' to update your academic information.

question: Can I have private projects?
answer: All projects in SynKro are private by default, meaning they are only visible to the members who have been explicitly invited to them and any supervising faculty.

question: How can I see a timeline of my tasks?
answer: To see a timeline, switch to the 'Gantt' or 'Timeline' view in the 'Tasks' section of your project. This will show your tasks laid out over time, which is great for planning.

question: Can I create a file from a template?
answer: While you can't create a file from a template directly, you can create a 'Project Template' that includes pre-made template files (like a report outline or presentation slide deck) in its file repository.

question: Can I mute a conversation?
answer: Yes, if a discussion or chat conversation is too noisy, you can 'Mute' it. You will no longer receive notifications for new messages in that specific conversation, but you can still view it manually.

question: Can I see if students have seen my announcement?
answer: Some versions of our announcement tool include analytics that show how many members of the project have viewed the announcement, helping you track its reach.

question: Does SynKro have an API?
answer: Yes, we do have a REST API available for advanced users and integrations. You can find the API documentation and request an API key from your 'Account Settings' -> 'Integrations' tab.

question: Can I export my personal data?
answer: Yes, in compliance with data privacy regulations like GDPR, you can request an export of your personal data. This option is available under 'Account Settings' -> 'Security'.

question: How do I change my profile URL?
answer: You may be able to customize your profile URL or username. Check in 'Account Settings' -> 'Profile' for an option to set a custom username, which will then be reflected in your profile's URL.

question: What is the activity feed?
answer: The activity feed, found on the project dashboard, is a real-time stream of all actions happening within the project. It shows who did what and when, such as creating a task, uploading a file, or leaving a comment.

question: Can I print my task list?
answer: Yes, there is usually a 'Print' option available in the 'Tasks' section. This will generate a printer-friendly version of your current task list view.

question: Is there a trash can for deleted files?
answer: Yes, when you delete a file, it is moved to a 'Trash' folder for 30 days before being permanently deleted. You can restore files from the trash during this period.

question: Can I react to messages with an emoji?
answer: Yes, you can add an emoji reaction to any message in a discussion or chat. Hover over the message and click the 'Add Reaction' button (usually a smiley face) to choose your emoji.

question: Can I message students' parents?
answer: No. SynKro is a platform for academic collaboration between students and faculty. Due to privacy regulations like FERPA, there are no features for communicating with parents or guardians.

question: How do I update to the latest version?
answer: SynKro is a web-based application, so you are always using the latest version automatically! There is nothing for you to download or update.

question: Do you sell my data?
answer: No, absolutely not. We are committed to protecting your privacy. We do not sell any of your personal data or project content to third parties.

question: How do I change my notification sound?
answer: You can customize notification sounds in the 'Notifications' section of your 'Account Settings'. You can choose from a list of sounds or disable them entirely.

question: Can I add milestones to my project?
answer: Yes, you can set key tasks as 'Milestones' to represent major goals or deadlines. Milestones are highlighted in timeline and Gantt chart views, making it easy to track major project phases.

question: How do I estimate time for a task?
answer: When creating or editing a task, you can add a 'Time Estimate' (e.g., in hours). This helps in planning and resource allocation. You can also log actual time spent against this estimate.

question: How do I log time spent on a task?
answer: To log time, open the task you worked on and find the 'Log Time' or 'Time Tracking' section. You can enter the amount of time you spent, and it will be recorded against the task.

question: Can I see who downloaded a file?
answer: For auditing purposes, project admins can often view an access log for a file, which may include information on who has viewed or downloaded it. This feature might vary based on your institution's plan.

question: Can I start a video call from the chat?
answer: Yes, SynKro integrates with popular video conferencing services. In a chat window, you may see a camera icon to instantly start a video call with that person or group, which will open in a new tab.

question: Can I create an assignment in SynKro?
answer: While you can create a project that represents an assignment, the official 'assignment' creation and submission should still be done in your university's LMS. SynKro is the workspace for completing the assignment, while the LMS is for the official grading.

question: Is there a way to use SynKro offline?
answer: SynKro is a cloud-based platform and requires an active internet connection to function. There is currently no offline mode available.

question: I lost my phone, how do I log in with 2FA enabled?
answer: When you set up Two-Factor Authentication (2FA), you were provided with a set of one-time use recovery codes. You can use one of these codes instead of the authenticator app code to log in. If you've lost your codes, you will need to contact support to begin an account recovery process.

question: How to change the language of the interface?
answer: You can change the display language of the SynKro interface in your 'Account Settings' under the 'Language & Region' section.

question: Can I view all my projects on a single timeline?
answer: Yes, your main dashboard may feature a 'Portfolio' or 'Master Timeline' view that consolidates key dates and milestones from all of your projects into a single, high-level Gantt chart.

question: How do I delete a task?
answer: To delete a task, you can usually click the options menu (three dots) next to the task in the list or board view and select 'Delete'. Please be careful, as this action often cannot be undone.

question: Can I lock a file to prevent editing?
answer: Some project roles may have the ability to 'lock' a file. This makes the file read-only for other members, preventing accidental edits while it is being reviewed or finalized.

question: Can I send a voice message?
answer: Currently, our chat feature supports text and file attachments. We do not have a built-in voice message recording feature at this time, but it's a popular suggestion we are considering for the future.

question: Can I check for plagiarism in student submissions?
answer: SynKro does not have a built-in plagiarism checker. We recommend using your university's official plagiarism detection tool (like Turnitin), which is often integrated into your LMS, for all formal submissions.

question: Does the site use cookies?
answer: Yes, like most modern web applications, we use cookies to manage your login session and remember your preferences. You can find detailed information in our Privacy Policy and Cookie Policy.

question: What are recovery codes for 2FA?
answer: Recovery codes are a set of single-use codes you receive when you enable Two-Factor Authentication (2FA). They are a backup method to access your account if you lose your phone or cannot use your authenticator app. It's very important to save them in a safe place.

question: Where can I find my user ID?
answer: Your unique User ID is generally not displayed publicly. If a support representative asks for it, you may be able to find it in your 'Account Settings' or in the URL of your profile page.

question: How do I see the history of a project?
answer: You can see the history of a project by viewing its 'Activity' feed. This log provides a complete, time-stamped record of all significant actions taken by team members.

question: Can I see my tasks on a calendar?
answer: Yes, you can view your tasks on a calendar. Go to the 'My Tasks' section and select the 'Calendar' view to see all your tasks with due dates laid out chronologically.

question: Can I share a folder with someone outside the project?
answer: No, all files and folders are contained within a project. To share a folder, you would need to invite the person into the project, even if it's just with a 'Viewer' role for read-only access.

question: How do I start a poll in a discussion?
answer: When creating a new post in a discussion, look for an 'Add Poll' or poll icon. This will allow you to ask a question and provide several options for team members to vote on, which is great for making decisions.

question: Can I see an analytics report for all my courses?
answer: Yes, your faculty dashboard includes a high-level analytics view that aggregates data from all your courses. It can show you overall student engagement, task completion rates, and other key metrics across all your classes.

question: I have a feature idea, where do I submit it?
answer: We love hearing ideas from our users! The best place to submit a feature idea is through the 'Suggest a Feature' link in the 'Help' menu. This sends your idea directly to our product team.

question: Can I use my personal email for SynKro?
answer: No, SynKro requires the use of an official university-provided email address for account creation and login. This is to ensure a secure and verified environment for all academic users.

question: Can I have multiple SynKro accounts?
answer: You should only have one SynKro account, which is tied to your official university identity. Managing multiple accounts is against our terms of service and can lead to confusion.

question: How do I know who created the project?
answer: The project creator is typically listed as the 'Owner' or first 'Admin' in the 'Members' list of the project.

question: What happens if I miss a deadline for a task?
answer: When a task's due date passes, it will be marked as 'Overdue'. This will be visible to you and your team members on the task list and dashboard, serving as a reminder to complete the work.

question: How do I see how large a file is?
answer: The file size is displayed next to the file name in the 'Files' list view. You can also see it in the file's detail panel.

question: Can I forward a message?
answer: Currently, there is no direct 'forward' button for messages. However, you can easily copy the text of a message and paste it into another conversation to share it.

question: How can I see which students are in which group?
answer: From your faculty dashboard, you can select a course, and it will show you a list of all projects (groups) and the student members within each one.

question: Why is the website layout broken?
answer: If the website layout appears broken or distorted, it is often caused by an outdated browser cache. Please try a hard refresh (Ctrl+Shift+R or Cmd+Shift+R) or clear your browser's cache completely.

question: Who owns the intellectual property of projects on SynKro?
answer: You and your team members own the intellectual property (IP) for the content you create, as per your university's academic policy. SynKro simply provides the platform and does not claim ownership of your work.

question: How do I find my colleagues on SynKro?
answer: You can search for other users, such as colleagues or classmates, using the global search bar at the top of the page. You can then view their profile or send them a direct message.

question: Can I add notes to a project?
answer: Yes, many projects have a 'Notes', 'Docs', or 'Wiki' section. This is a great place to keep shared project notes, meeting minutes, or important documentation that isn't a task or a file.

question: Can I change the status of a task to 'On Hold'?
answer: Yes, in addition to 'To Do' and 'In Progress', you can usually set custom statuses like 'On Hold' or 'Blocked'. This is often done by customizing the columns on your Kanban board in the project settings.

question: What is the total storage space for my account?
answer: Storage space is allocated on a per-project basis, not per-account. Each project has its own storage limit, which is typically quite large and sufficient for most academic work.

question: Will I get an email for every new message?
answer: By default, you may get email notifications for important events like direct messages and @mentions. You can fully customize which actions trigger an email in your 'Account Settings' -> 'Notifications'.

question: Can I add a co-instructor to my course?
answer: Yes, you can add other faculty members as co-instructors or Teaching Assistants (TAs) to your course. This will give them the same oversight and administrative permissions that you have for the student projects.

question: I can't click on a button.
answer: If a button is not clickable, it might be disabled due to permissions, or it could be a temporary bug. Please try refreshing the page. If the issue persists, check if you have the necessary role (e.g., admin) to perform that action.

question: Do you use facial recognition on my profile picture?
answer: No, we do not use any facial recognition or biometric analysis on any images you upload, including your profile picture.

question: Can I set 'out of office' status?
answer: Yes, you can set a status on your profile to indicate you are away or 'out of office'. This will be visible to your teammates when they try to message or assign tasks to you.

question: Can I see all projects from a specific course?
answer: Yes, you can filter your dashboard to show projects associated with a specific course. Look for a 'Filter by Course' or similar dropdown menu on your main projects list.

question: Can I search for a task across all my projects?
answer: Yes, the global search bar at the top of the page allows you to search for items, including tasks, across all of the projects you are a member of.

question: Can I edit a text file directly in SynKro?
answer: Yes, for simple text-based files (.txt, .md), SynKro includes a built-in text editor that allows you to make and save changes directly in your browser without needing to download and re-upload the file.

question: Is there a character limit for messages?
answer: While there is a technical limit, it is very high (typically over 10,000 characters), so you are unlikely to run into it for normal conversations or project discussions.

question: How do I communicate with just one student group?
answer: The best way to communicate with a single student group is to use the 'Discussion' tab or post an 'Announcement' within their specific project. This keeps the conversation private to that team.

question: I'm getting a 'network error' message.
answer: A 'network error' message indicates that your computer is having trouble connecting to our servers. Please check your internet connection (Wi-Fi or Ethernet). The issue is most likely with your local network or internet service provider.

question: Does SynKro share my data with advertisers?
answer: No, never. As an academic platform, we have a strict policy against sharing any of your personal data or project content with advertisers or data brokers.

question: How do I change my time zone?
answer: Your time zone settings can be adjusted in your 'Account Settings', typically under a 'Language & Region' or 'Profile' section. This ensures that all due dates and timestamps are displayed correctly for you.

question: Can I see a list of all members across all my projects?
answer: There isn't a single unified list of all members from all projects. However, you can see the member list for each project individually by navigating to its 'Members' tab.

question: Can I see who completed a task?
answer: Yes, the activity log for a task will show who marked it as complete and at what time. This information is often visible in the task's detail view.

question: Can I see who uploaded a file?
