answer: Yes, in the 'Project Settings' or on the 'Files' page, there is usually an indicator that shows how much of the project's storage quota has been used.

question: Can I pin a discussion post to the top?
answer: Yes, project admins can 'pin' an important discussion post. This will keep that post at the top of the discussion forum list so that it's the first thing team members see.

question: Can I review and approve student work before it's marked as done?
answer: Yes, you can set up a simple approval workflow. For example, you can have columns on a Kanban board for 'In Progress', 'Pending Review', and 'Approved'. Students would move tasks to 'Pending Review', and only you (the faculty member) could move them to 'Approved'.

question: The page content is overlapping.
answer: If page content is overlapping, it's often a sign of a display issue, which can sometimes be caused by using your browser's zoom feature. Please try resetting your browser's zoom to 100% (Ctrl+0 or Cmd+0). If that doesn't fix it, it may be a bug we need to fix.

question: I have a question about your privacy policy.
answer: If you have questions about our Privacy Policy, you can contact our privacy team for clarification. Their contact information can be found within the policy document itself.

question: Can I change the date my account was created?
answer: No, the creation date of your account is a fixed record and cannot be changed.

question: Can I link one project to another?
answer: You cannot formally link projects in a way that shares data. However, you can easily copy and paste the URL of one project into a task or note in another project to create a manual reference.

question: Can I convert a subtask into a full task?
answer: Yes, there is often an option to 'Promote' or 'Convert to Task'. This will take the subtask and turn it into a standalone task within the project, while removing it from the original parent task.

question: Can I see analytics on file usage?
answer: Project admins can typically view basic analytics for files, such as the number of views and downloads, to gauge which resources are being used most frequently by the team.

question: Can I send a message to everyone in the project?
answer: Yes, the best way to do this is by starting a new thread in the project's 'Discussion' forum. All project members will be notified. If you are an admin, you can also use the 'Announcement' feature for high-priority messages.

question: How do I add a TA to my course?
answer: You can add a Teaching Assistant (TA) by inviting them to your course on the faculty dashboard. You can assign them a 'TA' role, which gives them similar oversight permissions to yours, allowing them to view student projects and assist with administration.

question: The notifications are delayed.
answer: Email and push notifications are generally sent within a few minutes, but can sometimes be delayed by external mail servers or network conditions. If you are consistently experiencing significant delays, please contact support so we can investigate our delivery logs.

question: Is SynKro HIPAA compliant?
answer: No, SynKro is not designed for storing Protected Health Information (PHI) and is therefore not HIPAA compliant. You must not store any medical records or other sensitive patient data on the platform.

question: What is my role in SynKro?
answer: Your primary role is determined by your university status, either 'Student' or 'Faculty'. Within each project, you will also have a project-specific role, such as 'Admin', 'Member', or 'Viewer'.

question: I can't verify my email.
answer: If the verification link in your email isn't working or has expired, please request a new one from the login page. Also, make sure to check your spam or junk folder in case the email was misdirected.

question: How long is the onboarding tour?
answer: The optional interactive onboarding tour is very brief, taking only about two to three minutes to complete. It's designed to quickly show you the most important features of the platform.

question: Can I search for projects by member?
answer: While there isn't a direct 'search by member' filter on the dashboard, you can use the global search bar to search for a person's name. The search results will include projects that they are a member of.

question: Can I undo a task completion?
answer: Yes, you can easily undo a task completion. Simply find the task in the 'Completed' list and uncheck its checkbox. This will move it back to the active task list.

question: Can I access my files from a mobile device?
answer: Yes, you can access, view, and download all your project files using the web browser on your mobile device. The website is optimized for mobile access.

question: How do I block notifications from a specific project?
answer: You can customize your notification settings on a per-project basis. Go to the project you want to mute, find its notification settings, and you can choose to mute all notifications or only receive alerts for @mentions.

question: Can I create a read-only project for students?
answer: Yes, you can create a project and invite all students with the 'Viewer' role. This will allow them to see all the content, such as course materials or examples, without being able to make any changes.

question: The login page is not working.
answer: If the login page is not working, please first try clearing your browser's cache and cookies. If the problem continues, there may be a temporary issue with our service. You can check our System Status page for any known outages.

question: How do you handle inactive accounts?
answer: Inactive accounts may be subject to deletion after a prolonged period of inactivity (e.g., 2 years) as per our data retention policy. Users will be notified via email before any action is taken.

question: Can I change the order of projects on my dashboard?
answer: Yes, you can often rearrange your projects on the dashboard by dragging and dropping them into your preferred order. You can also use sorting and filtering options to customize your view.

question: Can I see all the comments in a project?
answer: There isn't a single page that lists every comment from every task and file. However, the project's 'Activity' feed will show a stream of recent comments from all parts of the project.

question: Can I set a priority for a task?
answer: Yes, you can set a priority level for tasks (e.g., Low, Medium, High, Urgent). This is usually done via a dropdown menu in the task details, and tasks can be sorted by priority.

question: How do I know who last modified a file?
answer: The file's version history will show you who uploaded each new version and when. This serves as a log of who last modified the file.

question: Can I reply to a specific message in a thread?
answer: Yes, our discussion forums support threaded replies. You can reply directly to a specific message to keep the conversation organized and easy to follow, rather than just posting at the bottom of the list.

question: Can I see a 'gradebook' view in SynKro?
answer: SynKro does not have its own gradebook, as that is a core function of your university's LMS. SynKro is focused on the collaborative process, while the LMS handles official records and grades.

question: The confirmation email went to spam.
answer: If our emails are going to your spam folder, please mark them as 'Not Spam'. This will help train your email client to deliver our future emails directly to your inbox.

question: Can I be tracked on this platform?
answer: Your activity within a project (e.g., completing a task, commenting) is visible to other project members and faculty for collaboration and assessment purposes. We do not track your activity for any other reason. For more details, please see our Privacy Policy.

question: Is there a limit on how many people I can direct message?
answer: You can have one-on-one direct messages or create small group chats. For very large groups, it is better to use a project's 'Discussion' forum.

question: Can I add a risk register to my project?
answer: While there isn't a dedicated 'Risk Register' tool, you could create a task list or a note within your project specifically for identifying, tracking, and mitigating project risks.

question: Can I see my tasks on a timeline?
answer: Yes, the 'Timeline' or 'Gantt' view in the 'Tasks' section will display your tasks visually over a period of time, showing their start and end dates.

question: Can I set a password on a file?
answer: No, you cannot set an individual password on a file within SynKro. Access to files is controlled by project membership. If you need password protection, you should apply it to the file on your computer before uploading it.

question: Can I record a video message?
answer: Currently, our platform does not support recording and sending video messages directly. However, you can record a video using another tool, upload it as a file, and share it in a chat or discussion.

question: Can I create a peer review assignment?
answer: You can facilitate a peer review assignment by setting up tasks for students to review each other's work. For instance, you could create tasks like 'Review Team B's Draft' and assign it to members of Team A, with a subtask to upload their feedback document.

question: I'm having keyboard shortcut issues.
answer: Some browser extensions, especially password managers or ad blockers, can interfere with web application keyboard shortcuts. Please try disabling your extensions to see if that resolves the issue. You can also see a full list of our shortcuts in the 'Help' menu.

question: How do I report another user?
answer: If another user is violating the code of conduct or harassing you, you can report them by going to their profile page and clicking the 'Report User' option. Our trust and safety team will review the report.

question: Where do I find my saved drafts?
answer: If you start writing a long discussion post or comment, the platform will automatically save a draft. You should see a 'Drafts' section in your chat or discussion area where you can resume editing.

question: Can I see which projects are currently active?
answer: Your main dashboard shows your active projects. You can sort them by 'Last Updated' to bring the most recently active projects to the top of the list.

question: How do I make a task a milestone?
answer: When you are editing a task, there is usually a checkbox or toggle option labeled 'Mark as Milestone'. Checking this will give the task special significance in reports and timeline views.

question: Can I see all the files in a project in one long list?
answer: Yes, the default 'List' view in the 'Files' section shows all files and folders in a single, sortable list, rather than as icons or a grid.

question: How do I find out who is in a group chat?
answer: In a group chat, you can view the list of all members by clicking on the group's name or information icon at the top of the chat window.

question: Can I see a summary of all student discussions?
answer: As a faculty member, you can access the 'Discussion' tab for each student project to read their conversations. There isn't a single aggregated view of all discussions from all projects.

question: The dropdown menu is not opening.
answer: If a dropdown menu is not opening when you click it, this could be a temporary script error. Please try reloading the page. If the issue persists, it may be a bug, and we would appreciate a bug report.

question: Do you perform security penetration tests?
answer: Yes, we regularly engage independent, third-party security firms to perform penetration tests and security audits of our platform to identify and remediate potential vulnerabilities.

question: Can I customize the look of my dashboard?
answer: While you cannot completely customize the layout, you can use features like sorting, filtering, and starring projects to personalize which information is most prominent on your dashboard.

question: What is a project 'owner'?
answer: The project 'owner' is typically the person who created the project. They have the highest level of administrative permissions by default, including the ability to delete the project.

question: Can I set a reminder for a task?
answer: Yes, you can set one or more reminders for a task. In the task details, look for a 'Reminders' or 'Notifications' section where you can set up alerts to be sent before the task is due (e.g., '1 day before').

question: Can I add a file from my phone?
answer: Yes, when you access the SynKro website on your phone's browser, the 'Upload File' button will open your phone's file browser, allowing you to upload photos, videos, and documents directly from your device.

question: How do I add someone to an existing group chat?
answer: In the group chat window, click on the group's name or info icon. This should open a panel with the member list and an 'Add Member' button to invite more people to the conversation.

question: Can I see if a student has started a task?
answer: You can see if a student has started a task if they move it from the 'To Do' column to the 'In Progress' column on the project's task board. This status change indicates that work has begun.

question: The notifications on my phone are not working.
answer: SynKro uses browser-based push notifications. Please ensure that you have granted our website permission to send you notifications in your mobile browser's settings. Also, check your phone's general notification settings for that browser.

question: How often should I change my password?
answer: It is good security practice to change your password periodically, for example, every 90 days. More importantly, you should always use a strong, unique password for every service and enable Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) for the best protection.

question: How can I see all my starred messages?
answer: In your chat or discussion area, there should be a 'Starred' or 'Favorites' filter or folder that will show you a list of all the messages you have previously starred for easy access.

question: Can I change the owner of a project?
answer: Yes, the current project owner can transfer ownership to another admin-level member of the project. This option is typically found in the 'Danger Zone' of the 'Project Settings'.

question: Can I bulk edit tasks?
answer: Yes, you can often select multiple tasks at once in the list view. Once selected, a menu will appear allowing you to perform bulk actions, such as changing the assignee, setting a due date, or adding a tag to all selected tasks.

question: What is the difference between a folder and a tag?
answer: A folder is a structural way to organize files; a file can only be in one folder at a time. A tag is a label; a file can have multiple tags, allowing for more flexible, cross-cutting categorization.

question: Can I get a transcript of a video call?
answer: SynKro does not provide transcripts of video calls itself. However, the video conferencing service you use (like Zoom or Google Meet) may have its own feature for generating a transcript of the meeting, which you could then save as a file in your project.

question: Can I set different deadlines for different student groups?
answer: Yes, since each student group has its own separate project, you can go into each project's settings and set a unique master deadline for that specific group.

question: The page is not displaying correctly in dark mode.
answer: Thank you for finding that! A visual bug in dark mode is something our developers need to fix. Please take a screenshot and submit a bug report through the 'Help' menu detailing which page has the issue.

question: I did not enable 2FA and I lost my password. What do I do?
answer: If you lose your password and do not have 2FA, you can use the standard 'Forgot Password' recovery process. An email with a reset link will be sent to your verified university email address, which serves as the primary method of identity verification.

question: Can I see analytics on my own productivity?
answer: Your personal profile may have a 'My Stats' or 'Analytics' tab that shows you data like your task completion rate, how many tasks you've completed on time, and your most active projects.

question: How do I find projects that are at risk?
answer: Your dashboard may have a feature that automatically flags projects as 'At Risk'. This is usually determined by factors like a high number of overdue tasks or being close to the final deadline with low progress.

question: Can I see all unassigned tasks in a project?
answer: Yes, you can filter the task list to show only 'Unassigned' tasks. This is a great way for team members to see what work is available to be picked up.

question: Can I download a folder as a zip file?
answer: Yes, you can download an entire folder and all of its contents. Right-click on the folder or use its options menu and select 'Download'. The folder will be compressed into a .zip file for you.

question: Can I delete a group chat?
answer: If you are the creator or an admin of a group chat, you may have the option to delete it. This action is usually permanent and will remove the conversation history for all members.

question: How do I create a new course in SynKro?
answer: Courses are typically synchronized from your university's official Learning Management System (LMS). You would create the course in the LMS, and it would then appear in your SynKro faculty dashboard, ready for you to manage the associated projects.

question: I found a typo in the user interface text.
answer: Thank you for your attention to detail! We appreciate you pointing that out. Please submit it via the 'Send Feedback' option in the 'Help' menu so we can get it corrected.

question: How do I know my connection to the site is secure?
answer: You can verify your connection is secure by looking for a padlock icon in your browser's address bar next to our website URL. This indicates that your connection is encrypted using HTTPS.

question: How do I update my job title on my profile?
answer: You can update your job title, major, or any other professional information by going to your 'Profile' page and clicking the 'Edit Profile' button.

question: What is a project 'charter'?
answer: A project charter is a formal document that outlines the project's scope, objectives, and participants. You can create a charter as a document in your project's 'Files' or 'Notes' section to serve as a reference for the entire team.

question: How can I sort tasks in a list?
answer: In the task list view, you can click on the column headers (like 'Due Date', 'Assignee', 'Priority') to sort the entire list based on that column.

question: Can I copy a file from one project to another?
answer: There isn't a direct 'copy to another project' function. The standard way to do this is to download the file from the source project and then upload it to the destination project.

question: How can I share a link in a message?
answer: You can simply copy and paste any URL into a chat message or discussion post. The platform will automatically recognize it as a link and make it clickable.

question: Can I see which student groups are working well together?
answer: You can gauge how well a group is working by looking at their project's analytics. A high level of activityfrequent task updates, active discussions, and consistent file uploadsis a good indicator of a healthy and collaborative team.

question: My password manager is not filling the login fields.
answer: If your password manager isn't working, please try updating it to the latest version. You can also try manually copying and pasting your username and password from the password manager into the login fields.

question: How is my account verified?
answer: Your account is verified through your university email address. By requiring a `.edu` email and sending a verification link, we ensure that only legitimate students and faculty from your institution can join the platform.

question: How can I leave feedback on a project?
answer: You can leave feedback by commenting on specific tasks, files, or by starting a new topic in the project's 'Discussion' forum. @mentioning team members is a great way to direct your feedback to the right people.

question: Can I assign a task without a due date?
answer: Yes, setting a due date for a task is optional. You can create tasks without a specific deadline, and they will appear in the task backlog.

question: Can I search the content of my files?
answer: Yes, our search functionality includes full-text search. When you use the search bar in the 'Files' section, it will look for your keywords not only in the file names but also within the content of supported documents (like PDFs and text files).

question: Can I search all of my chats at once?
answer: Yes, the search bar within the main 'Chat' view allows you to perform a global search across all of your direct messages and group conversations.

question: Can I duplicate a course setup?
answer: While you can't duplicate a 'course' itself, you can create a set of project templates for that course's assignments. When you teach the course again next semester, you can reuse these templates to quickly set up all the new student projects.

question: The formatting looks wrong in my message.
answer: If your message formatting looks wrong, it might be an issue with how you've applied Markdown syntax. Please double-check your use of asterisks, backticks, etc. You can find a quick guide to Markdown in our 'Help' section.

question: Where are your servers located?
answer: Our servers are hosted with major cloud providers like AWS and Google Cloud. The specific data center region is chosen based on your institution's location to ensure optimal performance and compliance with data residency laws.

question: Can I export my profile data?
answer: Yes, you have the right to data portability. You can request an export of your personal profile data from the 'Security' section of your 'Account Settings'.

question: How to set project goals?
answer: You can set project goals by creating 'Milestone' tasks for major achievements. You can also write down the overall project goals in the project description or in a dedicated 'Project Charter' document.

question: Can I see all tasks that are due today?
answer: Yes, your 'My Tasks' widget on the dashboard has a 'Today' view that filters your list to show only the tasks that are due today across all of your projects.

question: Can I set a file to be read-only?
answer: While you cannot make a single file read-only, project admins can sometimes set permissions on a folder to make its contents read-only for non-admin members.

question: How do I send a GIF?
answer: Our chat includes a GIF library integration. Look for a 'GIF' button in the chat input area. You can search for and insert animated GIFs directly from services like Giphy.

question: Can I view a student's profile?
answer: Yes, as a faculty member, you can click on any student's name within a project to view their public profile, which may include their major, skills, and other projects they are a part of in your courses.

question: How do I update my browser?
answer: Most modern browsers like Chrome and Firefox update automatically. You can check for updates manually by going to your browser's 'About' section in the settings menu.

question: What is your data retention policy?
answer: Our data retention policy outlines how long we store your data after you delete it or your account becomes inactive. You can find the full details in our publicly available Privacy Policy.

question: How do I clear my status?
answer: To clear your custom status, click on your profile picture, open the status editor, and you should see an option to 'Clear Status' or simply delete the text and save.

question: Can I see a burn-down chart for my project?
answer: Yes, for projects using agile methodologies like story points, the 'Reports' or 'Analytics' section often includes a burn-down chart. This chart visually tracks the completion of work against the planned timeline.

question: How do I add a comment without notifying everyone?
answer: Comments on tasks are generally visible to all project members. If you need to have a private conversation about a task with a specific person, it's better to start a direct message with them.

question: Can I have private files in a project?
answer: No, all files uploaded to a project are accessible to all members of that project. There is no feature for private files within a collaborative space.

question: Can I see who is typing in a chat?
answer: Yes, in real-time chat conversations, you will see a '...' typing indicator when another user is actively writing a message to you.

question: Can I create a discussion forum for the entire course?
answer: Yes, as a faculty member, you can create a 'Course Project'. This is a special project where all students from your course are automatically members. You can use its 'Discussion' tab as a central forum for the entire class.

question: I can't log in on a new device.
answer: If you have Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) enabled, you will need your authenticator app to log in on a new device. If you don't have 2FA and your password is correct, please ensure there are no network or firewall issues on the new device preventing access.

question: What is a data breach and what is your policy?
answer: A data breach is an incident where sensitive data is accessed without authorization. We have a comprehensive incident response plan in place. In the unlikely event of a breach, our policy is to promptly investigate, mitigate the impact, and notify affected users and institutions in accordance with legal requirements.

question: Can I see which projects are using the most storage?
answer: While you can see the storage usage for each individual project in its settings, there isn't currently a dashboard widget that ranks all your projects by storage size.

question: Can I manage dependencies between different projects?
answer: No, task dependencies can only be set between tasks within the same project. You cannot create a dependency that links a task in one project to a task in another.

question: How do I assign a task to myself?
answer: You can assign a task to yourself in the same way you assign it to others. Simply click the 'Assignee' field and select your own name from the list.

question: Is there a file activity log?
answer: Yes, each file has its own activity log. In the file's detail view, you can see a history of when new versions were uploaded, who commented on it, and who downloaded it.

question: Can I leave a group chat?
answer: Yes, you can leave a group chat at any time. In the chat's settings or member list, you will find an option to 'Leave Conversation'.

question: Can I see if a student has accepted their project invitation?
answer: Yes, in the 'Members' list of a project, invited members who have not yet accepted will be shown with a 'Pending' status. Once they accept, this status will disappear.

question: My browser is not supported.
answer: If you see a 'Browser not supported' message, it means you are using a very old browser that is not compatible with modern web technologies. Please update your browser to the latest version of Chrome, Firefox, Safari, or Edge to use SynKro.

question: Who can see my profile?
answer: Your profile is visible to other verified users (students and faculty) from your same institution. This is to help with finding project members and collaboration. It is not visible to the public or users from other universities.

question: Can I see all my comments in one place?
answer: There is not currently a feature that aggregates all of your own comments from across the entire platform into a single view. You can see your comments within the context of each task or discussion.

question: How do I know what has changed since my last visit?
answer: The project dashboard's 'Activity' feed is the best place to see what has changed. Additionally, any items with unread updates (like discussions or tasks with new comments) will be highlighted with a notification indicator.

question: Can I copy a task?
answer: Yes, you can duplicate an existing task. In the task's option menu, look for a 'Duplicate' or 'Copy Task' option. This will create a new task with the same title and description.

question: Can I embed a file in a task description?
answer: You can't embed the file visually, but you can attach the file to the task. The attachment will then appear as a clickable link or thumbnail directly within the task's details.

question: How do I turn off desktop notifications?
answer: You can manage desktop notification permissions in your browser's settings. You can also go to your SynKro 'Account Settings' -> 'Notifications' to disable browser push notifications from our platform.

question: Can I see a log of all announcements I've sent?
answer: Yes, your faculty dashboard will have an 'Announcements' section with a history or archive of all the global announcements you have previously sent.

question: The video preview is buffering or choppy.
answer: Buffering during video playback is almost always caused by a slow or unstable internet connection. Please try pausing the video for a few moments to allow it to load, or try connecting to a faster network.

question: I lost my 2FA recovery codes. What can I do?
answer: If you have lost both your phone and your 2FA recovery codes, you will need to go through our manual account recovery process. Please contact support to initiate this. The process involves identity verification and may take some time to complete.

question: Can I change the email for notifications?
answer: All notifications are sent to the official university email address associated with your account. It is not possible to have notifications sent to a different, personal email address.

question: Can I export my project dashboard to a PDF?
answer: Yes, there is often a feature to export a high-level summary of the project dashboard as a PDF report. Look for an 'Export' or 'Print to PDF' button on the project dashboard.

question: Can I convert a task into a project?
answer: If a task has become too large and complex, you can 'Promote to Project'. This action will create a brand new project using the task's title and description, and you can then break it down into smaller tasks there.

question: Can I see how many times a file has been viewed?
answer: Yes, the file details panel often includes analytics showing the number of unique views and downloads for that file, which can help you gauge its usage.

question: How do I remove someone from a group chat?
answer: If you are the admin of a group chat, you can remove a member by going to the member list, clicking the options menu next to their name, and selecting 'Remove from Conversation'.

question: Can I assign a project template to a group?
answer: You can't 'assign' a template directly. Instead, you would instruct the student groups to select your specific template from the list when they create their new project for your course.

question: I can't scroll down the page.
answer: If you are unable to scroll, it might be due to an overlay or a pop-up window that is not visible. Try pressing the 'Esc' key to close any hidden dialogs. If that doesn't work, reloading the page should fix it.

question: Can I see what data you have on me?
answer: Yes, under data privacy laws like GDPR, you have the right to access your data. You can request a complete export of your personal data from the 'Security' section of your 'Account Settings'.

question: How do I add a link to my personal website on my profile?
answer: You can add a link to your personal website or portfolio in the 'Edit Profile' section. There is typically a dedicated field for a website URL.

question: Can I see a report of all overdue projects?
answer: Yes, the dashboard for faculty often includes a reporting widget that specifically highlights all supervised projects that are past their final deadline.

question: Can I see all tasks due this month?
answer: Yes, you can filter your task list by due date. Choose a custom date range to see all tasks that are due within the current month.

question: Can I see a list of the largest files in my project?
answer: Yes, in the 'Files' section, you can sort the file list by the 'Size' column in descending order. This will bring the largest files to the top of the list.

question: What happens when I block someone?
answer: If you report a user for harassment and our team takes action, that user will be prevented from sending you direct messages or interacting with you on the platform.

question: Can I schedule an announcement to be sent later?
answer: Some versions of our faculty tools include the ability to schedule announcements. When you create an announcement, look for a 'Schedule for Later' option to select a future date and time for it to be sent.

question: How do I update my credit card information?
answer: Students and faculty do not need to provide credit card information, as SynKro is provided through your university. All billing matters are handled directly with the institution's administration.

question: Is the data I delete actually gone?
answer: When you delete data, it is initially 'soft-deleted' and moved to a temporary holding area (like a trash bin) for a short recovery period. After that, it is permanently purged from our active systems. Backups are kept for a limited time for disaster recovery, as outlined in our data retention policy.

question: Can I have a different language for different projects?
answer: No, the language setting is a global preference for your account and will apply to the user interface across all of your projects.

question: Can I get an email summary of my project's activity?
answer: Yes, you can subscribe to daily or weekly email digests. Go to your 'Account Settings' -> 'Notifications' to configure the frequency of these summary emails.

question: Can I create a task from an email?
answer: Yes, many projects have a unique email address. You can forward an email to this address, and it will be automatically converted into a new task in that project's inbox.

question: How do I find a file if I don't know which project it's in?
answer: You can use the global search bar at the top of the page. When you search for a file name there, the results will include matches from all of the projects you are a member of.

question: Can I set my status to 'Do Not Disturb'?
answer: Yes, you can set your status to 'Do Not Disturb'. This will pause all of your notifications temporarily, allowing you to focus. You can set it for a specific duration (e.g., 1 hour) or until you manually turn it off.

question: Can I see which students have downloaded the syllabus?
answer: Yes, if you upload the syllabus as a file in a course-wide project, you can use the file analytics to see a list of which students have viewed or downloaded it.

question: The 'Help' button is not working.
answer: If the 'Help' button or menu is unresponsive, please try reloading the page. If the issue continues, you can usually access our help documentation directly by going to help.synkro.edu.

question: What is a 'session cookie'?
answer: A 'session cookie' is a small piece of data our site stores in your browser that keeps you logged in as you navigate from page to page. It is temporary and is automatically deleted when you close your browser.

question: Can I change my username?
answer: Your primary identifier is your email, but you can usually change your display name or a customizable username/handle in your 'Profile Settings'.

question: Can I create a project from a template?
answer: Yes, when you click 'Create New Project', you will have the option to start from a blank project or choose from a list of available templates, including any custom templates created by your faculty.

question: How do I see tasks assigned to a specific person?
answer: In the 'Tasks' section, use the 'Filter' button and select a specific person from the 'Assignee' dropdown list. This will show you only the tasks assigned to that team member.

question: How do I create a new folder inside another folder?
answer: To create a sub-folder, first navigate into the parent folder where you want the new folder to be. Then, click the 'Create Folder' button. The new folder will be created inside the one you are currently viewing.

question: Can I delete my chat history?
answer: You can delete individual messages you have sent. While you cannot delete an entire chat history for everyone at once, you can leave or archive a conversation to remove it from your own view.

question: Can I link my Google Classroom to SynKro?
answer: While we integrate with university-wide Learning Management Systems like Canvas, we do not currently offer a direct integration with individual Google Classroom instances.

question: I'm getting a 'too many requests' error.
answer: A '429 Too Many Requests' error means you have tried to perform an action too many times in a short period. This is a rate-limiting measure to protect the platform. Please wait a few minutes before trying again.

question: Where can I find information about your data sub-processors?
answer: A list of the third-party sub-processors we use to provide our service (such as cloud hosting providers) is included in our Privacy Policy, in compliance with GDPR.

question: Can I have a different profile for my TA role vs my student role?
answer: No, you have one unified SynKro account. Your permissions will change depending on the context (e.g., in a course where you are a TA, you will have faculty-level access), but your profile information remains the same.

question: Can I add a custom field to my project?
answer: Depending on your plan, you may be able to add custom fields to your projects or tasks. For example, you could add a 'Department' field to projects or a 'Cost' field to tasks. This is typically managed in the project settings.

question: Can I see a report of time spent per task?
answer: Yes, the time tracking reports allow you to see a breakdown of all the time that has been logged for each individual task in your project.

question: What is the folder structure for a new project?
answer: A new, blank project starts with a single root 'Files' directory. You are free to create any folder structure within it that best suits your team's needs. If you start from a template, it may already include a pre-defined folder structure.

question: Can I format a table in my message?
answer:
Yes, you can format a simple table using Markdown. Use pipes `|` to separate columns and hyphens `-` to create the header row. For example: `| Header 1 | Header 2 | 
 |---|---|
| Cell 1 | Cell 2 |`

question: How can I see which students are collaborating the most?
answer: The course analytics dashboard often includes metrics on collaboration, such as the number of comments made, discussions started, and files uploaded by each student. This can help you identify highly engaged team members.

question: I'm having trouble with payments.
answer: Individual students and faculty do not make payments directly to SynKro. Your access is provided through your university's license. If you are an administrator with a billing question, please contact our institutional support line.

question: Does my faculty advisor see my direct messages?
answer: No. Your direct messages (DMs) with other users are private. Faculty advisors can only see public conversations within the 'Discussion' tab of the projects they oversee.

question: Can I see a list of all the projects I have created?
answer: Yes, on your dashboard, you can filter your project list to show only the projects that you are the 'Owner' or 'Creator' of.

question: How do I manage project resources like team members' availability?
answer: You can manage team availability by using the integrated project calendar. Team members can block out times they are unavailable, and this will be visible when scheduling tasks with due dates.

question: Can I add a 'start' and 'end' time to a task due date?
answer: Yes, when setting a due date, you can also specify a time of day for both the start and end dates, allowing for more precise scheduling.

question: How do I download an entire folder?
answer: To download an entire folder, navigate to the 'Files' section, right-click on the folder you wish to download, and select the 'Download' option. The folder and its contents will be compressed into a single zip file.

question: How do I share a message from one project to another?
answer: There is no direct 'share' function between projects. The easiest way is to copy the content of the message from the first project and paste it into a new message or discussion post in the second project.

question: Can I create a project for just my TAs?
answer: Yes, you can create a private project and invite only your Teaching Assistants (TAs). This can serve as a private workspace for you and your TAs to coordinate course management tasks.

question: The website is asking for location access. Why?
answer: We may ask for location access to help improve your experience, for example by setting your timezone automatically. Granting access is optional, and we do not store your precise location data. You can find more details in our Privacy Policy.

question: How do I know if the website is the real SynKro site?
answer: Always check that the URL in your browser's address bar starts with 'https://' and is a domain you recognize, like 'app.synkro.edu'. Look for the padlock icon, which indicates a secure connection. Be wary of links from suspicious emails.

question: Can I change the notification settings for a specific user?
answer: You cannot change notification settings for another user. You can, however, mute conversations with a specific user if you do not wish to receive notifications from them.

question: Can I get a notification when a project is archived?
answer: Yes, when a project you are a member of is archived by an administrator, all members typically receive a notification informing them of the change in the project's status.

question: Can I add a task to my personal calendar?
answer: Yes, you can sync your SynKro tasks with external calendars. Find the 'Calendar Sync' option, which will provide a special URL (iCal feed) that you can add to your Google Calendar, Outlook, or other calendar apps.

question: Can I see who has viewed a file?
answer: Yes, for many file types, project admins and faculty can see a 'View Log' in the file's details. This shows a list of which project members have opened and viewed the file.

question: How do I find all messages where I was mentioned?
answer: Your notification center (bell icon) has a section specifically for '@mentions'. This provides a convenient list of all the times you have been tagged in conversations across all your projects.

question: Can I see which student groups are falling behind?
answer: Yes, your faculty dashboard is designed to highlight projects that are 'At Risk'. This is typically determined by a low percentage of task completion relative to the upcoming project deadline, helping you identify groups that may need support.

question: The time displayed on the site is wrong.
answer: If the time is incorrect, please check your account's time zone setting. You can adjust this in 'Account Settings' -> 'Language & Region' to match your current location.

question: What is 'salting' a password?
answer: 'Salting' is a security technique where a unique, random string (the 'salt') is added to each user's password before it is hashed and stored. This ensures that identical passwords result in different hashes, providing strong protection against dictionary and rainbow table attacks.

question: How do I remove my phone number from my account?
answer: You can remove your phone number by going to 'Account Settings' -> 'Security'. Find the phone number field and you should see an option to edit or delete it. Note that this may affect your account recovery options.

question: Can I have sub-projects within a larger project?
answer: While you cannot nest projects within each other, you can simulate this structure by creating separate task lists or using special tags to represent 'sub-projects'. For very large initiatives, creating separate, linked projects is the recommended approach.

question: Can I see a report of all my logged time?
answer: Yes, you can generate a personal time report. Go to your profile or a dedicated 'Reports' section to see a summary of all the time you have logged across your tasks, which can be filtered by date.

question: How do I create a link to a specific folder?
answer: Navigate to the folder you want to share, and you can copy the URL directly from your browser's address bar. When another project member clicks this link, it will take them directly to that folder view.

question: Can I format a quote in a message?
answer: Yes, you can format a blockquote using Markdown. Start a line with the greater-than symbol `>` to format it as a quote. For example: `> This is a quote.`

question: Can I see which students have not joined their project yet?
answer: Yes. In the 'Members' tab of each project, any student who was invited but has not yet accepted will be marked as 'Pending'. This allows you to easily see who has not yet joined their assigned group.

question: I am having trouble with a file preview.
answer: If a file preview is not loading correctly, it could be a temporary issue or the file might be corrupted. Please try downloading the file to see if it opens correctly on your computer. If the file is fine but the preview is broken, please report it as a bug.

question: Does SynKro use tracking cookies?
answer: We use essential cookies for login sessions and preferences. We do not use third-party advertising or tracking cookies that follow your activity across other websites. For full details, please refer to our Cookie Policy.

question: Can I see who has viewed my profile?
answer: For privacy reasons, SynKro does not have a feature that shows you who has viewed your profile page.

question: Can I create a 'to-do', 'doing', 'done' workflow?
answer: Yes, that is the default setup for the Kanban board view in the 'Tasks' section. It provides 'To Do', 'In Progress', and 'Done' columns, allowing you to visually track your workflow.

question: Can I customize the columns on my Kanban board?
answer: Yes, project admins can customize the Kanban board. You can rename the existing columns or add new ones to perfectly match your team's specific workflow (e.g., 'Backlog', 'Design', 'In Review', 'Approved').

question: Is there a way to request a file from a teammate?
answer: The best way to request a file is to create a new task and assign it to your teammate. You can title the task something like 'Upload the final report' and set a due date for them.

question: How do I make an unordered (bullet) list in a message?
answer: You can create a bulleted list using Markdown. Start each line item with either a hyphen `-` or an asterisk `*`, followed by a space.

question: How do I make an ordered (numbered) list in a message?
answer: To create a numbered list, simply start each line with a number followed by a period and a space (e.g., `1. First item`, `2. Second item`).

question: Can I randomize student groups?
answer: While SynKro does not have a built-in 'random group generator', you would use an external tool to randomize your class roster into groups, then use our 'Bulk Project Creation' tool with a CSV of those groups to set them up quickly.

question: The emoji I sent looks different to my friend.
answer: Emojis can look slightly different depending on the operating system (Windows, macOS, Android, iOS) and browser being used. This is normal, as each system has its own style for rendering them, but the meaning remains the same.

question: How do you protect against SQL injection?
answer: We protect against SQL injection attacks by exclusively using parameterized queries and prepared statements for all database interactions. This ensures that user input is always treated as data and never as executable code, which is the industry-standard best practice.

question: Can I have two-factor authentication with SMS?
answer: While we strongly recommend using an authenticator app for the highest level of security, some plans may offer SMS-based 2FA as an alternative. You can check the available options in your 'Security' settings.

question: How can I see all of a project's tasks on one page?
answer: The 'List' view in the 'Tasks' section is designed to show all of a project's tasks on a single, scrollable page. You can use filters if you want to narrow down the view.

question: Can I add a description to my subtask?
answer: While subtasks are typically just a single line of text for simple checklist items, more advanced task management features may allow for adding detailed descriptions to each individual subtask.

question: Can I see which files are taking up the most space?
answer: Yes, in the 'Files' section, you can sort the file list by the 'Size' column. Clicking it will arrange all the files from largest to smallest, showing you exactly what is using the most storage.

question: How do I start a thread in a discussion?
answer: To start a new thread, go to the 'Discussion' forum and click the 'New Post' or 'Start Discussion' button. To reply within an existing thread, simply use the 'Reply' button on a specific message.

question: Can I export student grades from SynKro?
answer: No, SynKro does not store official grades. All grading should be done in your university's official LMS, and you would export the gradebook from there. SynKro is for managing the project work, not the final grades.

question: How do I enable Javascript?
answer: JavaScript is a core technology for modern websites and is enabled by default in all major browsers. If it has been disabled, you can re-enable it in your browser's content or security settings. A web search for 'enable javascript' plus your browser name will provide instructions.

question: How do I permanently delete a file from the trash?
answer: Files in the trash are automatically purged after 30 days. If you wish to delete a file permanently immediately, you can go to the 'Trash', select the file, and you will see an option to 'Delete Forever'.

question: What happens to my account when I graduate?
answer: Your SynKro account is tied to your university email. When your university deactivates your email account after graduation, you will lose access to SynKro. Be sure to export any portfolio work you wish to keep before then.

question: Can I link to a specific task?
answer: Yes, every task has its own unique URL. You can open a task and copy the URL from your browser's address bar to share a direct link with a teammate.

question: Can I convert a checklist item into a subtask?
answer: Yes, if a simple checklist item in a task description needs to become more detailed (with its own assignee or due date), there is often an option to convert it into a full subtask.

question: Can I preview a spreadsheet in SynKro?
answer: Yes, SynKro supports in-browser previews for spreadsheet files like Microsoft Excel (.xls, .xlsx) and CSV files. You can view the data without needing to download the file and open it in spreadsheet software.

question: Can I search for messages sent on a specific date?
answer: Yes, our advanced search in the chat and discussion areas allows you to filter messages by date. You can use search operators like 'before:YYYY-MM-DD' or 'after:YYYY-MM-DD' to narrow down your search.

question: Can I see if a student has viewed my feedback?
answer: While you cannot see if a student has read a specific comment, the project's activity log will show if they have opened the task or file where you left the feedback, which can serve as an indicator.

question: The website is not displaying images.
answer: If images are not displaying, it could be a browser issue or a network problem. Please try a hard refresh (Ctrl+Shift+R or Cmd+Shift+R). Also, some browser extensions (like ad blockers) can sometimes mistakenly block images, so try disabling them.

question: Do you have a bug bounty program?
answer: Yes, we have a responsible disclosure and bug bounty program for security researchers. You can find the details and scope on our 'Security' page. We appreciate the community's help in keeping our platform safe.

question: How do I manage my integrations?
answer: You can manage all your third-party integrations (like Google Drive, Dropbox, etc.) from the 'Integrations' tab in your 'Account Settings'. You can connect new services or disconnect existing ones from this page.

question: Can I see all projects associated with a specific tag?
answer: Yes, on your dashboard, you can click on any project tag to filter your view and see only the projects that have been labeled with that specific tag.

question: Can I see all of my tasks in one place?
answer: Yes, the 'My Tasks' view on your main dashboard is designed for this. It consolidates all tasks assigned to you from every project into a single, manageable list.

question: Can I see the total number of files in a project?
answer: Yes, the 'Files' section of a project will typically display a count of the total number of files and folders at the top of the page or in a summary view.

question: How do I know who is in my direct message group?
answer: At the top of the direct message window, you can click on the names of the participants or an info icon to see a full list of everyone included in that specific conversation.

question: How do I archive a course?
answer: When a semester is over, you can archive a course from your faculty dashboard. This will archive all of the student projects associated with that course in a single action, cleaning up your dashboard for the new semester.

question: I am getting a 'gateway timeout' error (504).
answer: A '504 Gateway Timeout' error means one of our servers is not getting a timely response from another server it needs to communicate with. This is a temporary issue on our end. Please try your request again in a few minutes.

question: What is 'social engineering'?
answer: 'Social engineering' is a tactic used by attackers to manipulate people into divulging confidential information, like their password. This is often done through phishing emails. Always be cautious of unsolicited requests for personal information.

question: Can I share my account with my friend?
answer: No, sharing your account is a violation of our terms of service and a major security risk. Each user must have their own individual account tied to their university email. Never share your password with anyone.

question: What is the difference between a project and a task?
answer: A 'project' is the large-scale goal or workspace (e.g., 'Capstone Thesis'). A 'task' is a specific, actionable item within that project that needs to be completed (e.g., 'Write Chapter 1').

question: How do I see the details of a task?
answer: You can see the full details of a task, including its description, comments, attachments, and activity history, by clicking on its title in the list or board view.

question: Can I comment on a specific part of an image?
answer: Yes, our image previewer allows for annotations. You can click on a specific area of an image and leave a comment that is pinned to that spot, which is great for providing precise design feedback.

question: Can I 'like' a message?
answer: Yes, you can 'like' a message by using an emoji reaction. Hover over the message and you can add a thumbs-up or any other emoji to show your reaction.

question: Can I import my class roster?
answer: Yes, you can import your class roster as a CSV file to quickly invite all your students to a course-wide project. This is an alternative if your school's LMS is not fully integrated with SynKro.

question: The website is asking me to accept cookies.
answer: To comply with privacy regulations, we must ask for your consent to use cookies when you first visit our site. Accepting is necessary for features like staying logged in. You can manage your preferences in our Cookie Policy.

question: Can I use a password manager with SynKro?
answer: Yes, absolutely! We highly recommend using a password manager (like 1Password, Bitwarden, or LastPass) to generate and store a strong, unique password for your SynKro account.

question: How do I find people to collaborate with?
answer: You can search for other students or faculty from your university using the global search bar. You can also look for projects that are open to new members or post in a campus-wide forum if one exists.

question: Can I add a cover image to my project?
answer: Yes, you can customize your project by adding a cover image or banner. This option is usually found in the 'Project Settings' and helps make your project card on the dashboard more visually distinct.

question: What happens to a recurring task when I complete it?
answer: When you complete an instance of a recurring task, the platform will automatically generate the next instance of that task with its next scheduled due date.

question: Can I drag and drop files to upload them?
answer: Yes, the 'Files' section supports drag-and-drop. You can simply drag one or more files from a folder on your computer and drop them directly onto the file list in your browser to start the upload.

question: How do I edit the topic of a discussion thread?
answer: If you are the creator of a discussion thread, you can edit its main topic or title by clicking the options menu on your original post and selecting 'Edit Topic'.

question: Can I see which student created which task?
answer: Yes, the activity log for every task shows who created it. This information is often displayed in the task's detail view as 'Created by [Student Name]'.

question: How do I check my internet speed?
answer: You can check your internet speed by using a free online tool like Speedtest.net or Fast.com. This can help you determine if performance issues you are experiencing are related to your own network connection.

question: What is a 'man-in-the-middle' attack?
answer: A 'man-in-the-middle' (MITM) attack is where an attacker secretly intercepts communication between two parties. We protect against this by enforcing HTTPS (SSL/TLS) across our entire platform, which encrypts all data between your browser and our servers.

question: Can I change my notification preferences for mobile vs desktop?
answer: Yes, the notification settings often allow you to set different preferences for different delivery methods. For example, you could choose to receive push notifications on mobile but only email summaries on desktop.

question: How do I find a project if I forgot the name?
answer: If you forget the project's name, you can try searching for the name of a team member who is in the project, or for a unique keyword that might be in one of its tasks or files, using the global search.

question: Can I see how many tasks are in each column of my Kanban board?
answer: Yes, the header of each column on the Kanban board typically displays a count of the number of tasks currently in that stage of the workflow.

question: Can I have private folders in a project?
answer: No, all folders created within a project are visible to all members of that project. There is no functionality for creating private folders that only certain members can see.

question: How do I send a direct message?
answer: To send a direct message (DM), click the main 'Chat' icon, then click the 'New Message' button. You can then search for the user by name and start your private conversation.

question: Can I post a video announcement?
answer: You cannot record a video directly in the announcement tool. However, you can record a video using another service (like Loom or YouTube), and then paste the link to the video in your text-based announcement for students to watch.

question: The text in the input field is the wrong color.
answer: If text is appearing in the wrong color (e.g., white on a white background), this is a visual bug, likely related to a theme or dark mode issue. Thank you for noticing! Please report this bug with a screenshot so our developers can fix it.

question: Can I use a physical security key for 2FA?
answer: Yes, we support the use of FIDO2/WebAuthn hardware security keys (like a YubiKey) for Two-Factor Authentication. This is the most secure method of 2FA available. You can register your key in the 'Security' settings.

question: Can I see my most active projects?
answer: Yes, your dashboard can be sorted by 'Last Updated', which will automatically bring your most recently active projects to the top of your list.

question: How do I search within a specific project?
answer: When you are inside a project, there is a dedicated search bar for that project. Using this search bar will limit the search results to only items (tasks, files, discussions) within the project you are currently viewing.

question: Can I see who is 'watching' a task?
answer: Yes, in the task details, you can see a list of all the users who are 'watching' or 'subscribed' to that task for updates.

question: Can I preview a presentation file?
answer: Yes, we support in-browser previews of presentation files like Microsoft PowerPoint (.ppt, .pptx) and Google Slides. You can flip through the slides directly on the platform.

question: How do I know what my notification settings are?
answer: You can review and change all of your current notification settings by visiting the 'Notifications' tab in your main 'Account Settings'.

question: Can I see a list of all students in my course?
answer: Yes, from your faculty dashboard, you can select a course to view its full roster of enrolled students who have a SynKro account.

question: What does 'clearing your cache' mean?
answer: 'Clearing your cache' means deleting the temporary files your browser has stored from websites. Sometimes these files can become outdated or corrupted, causing display or performance issues. Clearing them forces the browser to download the fresh, latest versions.

question: Is my session cookie secure?
answer: Yes, our session cookies are transmitted securely over HTTPS and are set with the 'HttpOnly' and 'Secure' flags. This prevents them from being accessed by client-side scripts, protecting your session from being hijacked.

question: How do I disconnect my Google account?
answer: You can disconnect your Google account from the 'Integrations' or 'Security' section of your 'Account Settings'. There will be an option to 'Unlink' or 'Disconnect' your Google account.

question: Can I see which projects have no owner?
answer: All projects must have at least one 'Admin' or 'Owner'. It is not possible for a project to be ownerless. If the owner leaves, they must transfer ownership first.

question: Can I set a color for my task tags?
answer: Yes, you can assign different colors to your task tags to make them more visually distinct on the task board. This helps you quickly identify different types of work at a glance.

question: Can I recover a folder I deleted?
answer: Just like files, deleted folders are moved to the 'Trash' for a 30-day recovery period. You can go to the trash and restore the entire folder and all of its contents.

question: Can I forward an email to a project discussion?
answer: Yes, each project's discussion forum has a unique email address. You can forward an email to this address, and it will be automatically posted as a new discussion topic, with the email's subject as the title and body as the content.

question: Can I view the platform as a student would see it?
answer: Yes, faculty accounts often have a 'View as Student' mode. This allows you to temporarily see the platform from a typical student's perspective, which is useful for preparing tutorials or understanding their experience.

question: Where can I find the version number of the app?
answer: The current version number of the web application is usually displayed in the footer of the page or in an 'About SynKro' section in the settings.

question: Does SynKro use tracking cookies for advertising?
answer: No, we do not use third-party tracking cookies for advertising purposes. We only use essential cookies for site functionality (like keeping you logged in) and anonymous analytics to improve our service.

question: Can I hide my online status?
answer: Currently, there is no option to appear offline or hide your online status. The presence indicator is designed to facilitate real-time collaboration among team members.

question: Can I see a list of all archived projects?
answer: Yes, you can access a complete list of all your archived projects by selecting the 'View Archived Projects' option from your main account or profile menu.

question: Can I see a history of changes for a task?
answer: Yes, every task has an activity log or history. In the task's detail view, you can see a complete history of all changes, including when it was created, who it was assigned to, and when its status was changed.

question: Can I create a shortcut to a file?
answer: While you can't create a 'shortcut' file, you can copy the link to a file and paste it into a task description or discussion post for easy access from another part of your project.

question: Can I save a chat conversation?
answer: You can export a chat conversation as a text file for your records. Look for an 'Export Conversation' option in the chat settings menu.

question: Can I create a grading scale in SynKro?
answer: No, grading scales and official gradebooks are managed within your university's Learning Management System (LMS). SynKro is the platform for the project work itself, while the LMS handles the formal assessment.

question: I'm having trouble with the mobile website.
answer: If you're having trouble with the mobile site, please ensure your mobile browser is updated to the latest version. Clearing your mobile browser's cache and cookies can also resolve many common issues.

question: How do I report a privacy concern?
answer: If you have a privacy concern, please contact our Data Protection Officer (DPO) or privacy team. Their contact information is available in our Privacy Policy.

question: Can I see all files I have commented on?
answer: There is not currently a single view that aggregates all files you have personally commented on. Your activity feed on your profile may show your recent comments.

question: How do I transfer all my projects to another user?
answer: You must transfer ownership of each project individually. Go into the settings of each project you own and use the 'Transfer Ownership' feature to assign it to another admin member.

question: Can I see a report of task completion rates?
answer: Yes, the project 'Analytics' or 'Reports' section includes dashboards that show task completion rates, the number of overdue tasks, and other key performance indicators for your project.

question: Can I set an expiration date on a file link?
answer: Since SynKro does not use public shareable links, there is no need for expiration dates. Access is determined by project membership, which can be revoked at any time by a project admin.

question: Can I see who has seen my message in a group chat?
answer: While one-on-one DMs have read receipts, this feature is typically disabled in larger group chats to reduce notification clutter. You can assume active members have seen the message.

question: Can I add a rubric to a project template?
answer: You can attach a document file (e.g., a PDF or Word doc) of the rubric to the project template. The interactive rubric for grading would still be managed in your LMS.

question: I can't find a user I'm searching for.
answer: If you can't find a user, please double-check the spelling of their name. Also, ensure they have an active account at your university, as only registered users will appear in the search.

question: Is it safe to save my password in my browser?
answer: While saving your password in a modern, trusted browser is generally safe for convenience, using a dedicated password manager is the most secure practice for managing all of your online credentials.

question: How do I find out what's new with the platform?
answer: We post updates about new features and improvements in our 'What's New' section or on our official blog. You may also see in-app notifications highlighting a new feature.

question: What is a 'work breakdown structure' (WBS)?
answer: A 'work breakdown structure' is a project management technique of breaking a large project down into smaller, manageable components. In SynKro, you can achieve this by creating task lists, tasks, and subtasks to represent the hierarchy of your WBS.

question: Can I set a task to be 'in review'?
answer: Yes, you can customize the columns on your project's Kanban board to create an 'In Review' stage. Team members can then drag tasks into this column when they are ready for feedback or approval.

question: Can I see a list of all files in a folder and its sub-folders?
answer: Yes, the file list view is hierarchical. You can expand and collapse folders to see all the nested files and sub-folders within them.

question: How do I add a link to text?
answer: You can create a hyperlink using Markdown syntax. The format is `[link text](http://example.com)`. This will display 'link text' as a clickable link to the specified URL.

question: Can I export the discussion forum?
answer: Yes, faculty members or project admins often have the ability to export the content of a project's discussion forum as a text or HTML file for archival or assessment purposes.

question: I'm having trouble with drag and drop.
answer: If drag-and-drop is not working, it can sometimes be caused by a browser extension interfering with the page. Please try disabling your extensions or using a different browser to see if that resolves the problem.

question: Can I access SynKro through my university's portal?
answer: Yes, many universities have Single Sign-On (SSO) integration. This means you can log in to your main university portal, and from there, you will have a link to access SynKro without needing to log in again.

question: Can I be a member of projects at different universities?
answer: No, your SynKro account is tied to a single university. You cannot be a member of projects that originate from a different institution.

question: How do I manage project risks?
answer: You can manage project risks by creating a dedicated 'Risk Register' as a note or task list in your project. Here, you can list potential risks, their probability, impact, and mitigation plans.

question: Can I see all my tasks across all projects in one calendar?
answer: Yes, the 'My Tasks' calendar view on your dashboard is a master calendar that aggregates all of your assigned tasks with due dates from all your projects into a single, unified view.

question: Can I see who deleted a file?
answer: Yes, the project's main activity log will record when a file was deleted and which user performed the action. You can also see this information in the 'Trash' folder.

question: Can I turn off email notifications for just one project?
answer: Yes, notification settings are granular. You can go into a specific project's settings and customize the notifications for that project only, without affecting your global settings.

question: Can I see an overview of all my courses?
answer: Yes, the faculty dashboard is designed to give you a portfolio overview of all the courses you are teaching, with key metrics and links to manage each one.

question: I am getting a 'Javascript heap out of memory' error.
answer: This is a technical error that can happen in your browser when a page is trying to process a very large amount of data. Please try closing other browser tabs and reloading the page. If it happens consistently on a specific page, please report it as a bug.

question: What is your server uptime guarantee?
answer: We have a service level agreement (SLA) with our institutional partners that guarantees a high level of uptime, typically 99.9% or higher. You can monitor our real-time status on our public System Status page.

question: Can I customize my profile page layout?
answer: You can customize the content of your profile page (like your bio, skills, and picture), but the overall layout and structure of the page are standardized and cannot be changed.

question: Can I get a weekly summary of project progress?
answer: Yes, you can configure your notification settings to receive a weekly email digest. This email will summarize the key activities and progress made in your selected projects over the past week.

question: How do I see all tasks that don't have a due date?
answer: In the task filtering options, you can choose to filter by 'Due Date' and select the option for 'No Due Date'. This will show you a list of all the tasks in your project's backlog.

question: Can I add an entire folder of files at once?
answer: While you cannot select a folder to upload, you can select all the files within a folder on your computer and drag and drop them all into SynKro at the same time to upload them in bulk.

question: How do I edit my last message quickly?
answer: In many chat interfaces, you can press the 'Up Arrow' key on your keyboard to quickly start editing your most recently sent message.

question: Can I see which students are working late at night?
answer: For privacy reasons, the exact timestamps of student activity are generally not exposed in a way that allows for monitoring work hours. You can see the date of an activity, but not always the specific time of day.

question: The 'back' button in my browser isn't working correctly.
answer: Modern web applications like SynKro sometimes manage navigation internally, which can occasionally conflict with the browser's native 'back' button. We recommend using the in-app navigation links and breadcrumbs for the most reliable experience.

question: How do you handle government requests for data?
answer: We will only disclose user data in response to a valid and legally binding request from a law enforcement agency. We have a strict policy for handling such requests, which is detailed in our Privacy Policy.

question: Where can I find my student ID number in my profile?
answer: We do not store personally identifiable information like your official student ID number in your SynKro profile. Your account is linked to your university email address only.

question: Can I see which projects are using which templates?
answer: Yes, when you view a project's details or settings, it will typically indicate if it was created from a template and, if so, which one.

question: How do I print a single task?
answer: Open the task you wish to print. In the task's option menu, you should find a 'Print' option that will generate a printer-friendly view of that specific task and its details.

question: How do I find out what a specific file format is?
answer: The file's format is indicated by its extension (e.g., '.pdf', '.docx', '.jpg'). If you are unsure what software to use to open a file, a quick web search for the file extension will usually provide the answer.

question: Can I get notifications on my desktop?
answer: Yes, you can enable browser push notifications. The first time you log in, your browser will ask for permission. If you said no, you can re-enable this in your browser's settings for our site.

question: Can I filter the activity log by a specific student?
answer: Yes, the activity log in a project is filterable. You can filter it to show only the actions taken by a specific student, which is useful for assessing their individual contributions.

question: The page is not updating with new information.
answer: If the page is not showing new information that you know exists, you are likely seeing a cached version. Please try a hard refresh (Ctrl+Shift+R or Cmd+Shift+R) to force your browser to fetch the latest data from our server.

question: What is a 'brute-force' attack?
answer: A 'brute-force' attack is an attempt to guess a password by trying thousands or millions of possibilities. We protect against this by implementing rate limiting and account lockouts after a certain number of failed login attempts.

question: Can I change the email digest frequency?
answer: Yes, in your 'Notification Settings', you can choose the frequency of email digests. Options typically include 'Daily', 'Weekly', or 'Never'.

question: Can I see all my projects on a map?
answer: No, SynKro does not have a geographical map view for projects, as our collaboration is digital and not tied to physical locations.

question: Can I see how long a task has been in a specific column?
answer: Yes, advanced analytics on the Kanban board can show you the 'cycle time' for tasks, which is the amount of time a task spends in each column. This helps identify bottlenecks in your workflow.

question: Can I upload a file from a URL?
answer: Currently, you can only upload files from your local computer or a connected cloud storage service like Google Drive. We do not support uploading a file directly from a web URL.

question: Can I see if a user has blocked me?
answer: For privacy reasons, the platform does not indicate if another user has reported or muted you.

question: Can I create a new project on behalf of a student group?
answer: Yes, as a faculty member, you can create a new project and assign the students to it, making one of them the project admin. This is often done using the 'Bulk Project Creation' tool.

question: The 'Enter' key is not submitting my form.
answer: In some multi-line text fields (like a description or comment box), the 'Enter' key creates a new line. To submit the form, you may need to press 'Ctrl+Enter' or 'Cmd+Enter', or click the 'Submit' button with your mouse.

question: Can I trust browser extensions with my SynKro data?
answer: You should be very cautious about which browser extensions you install. Some malicious extensions can read data from your web pages. Only install extensions from trusted developers and review the permissions they request.

question: How do I set up my profile for the first time?
answer: When you first log in, you will be prompted to set up your profile. This involves confirming your name, uploading a profile picture, and adding optional information like your major and a short bio.

question: How do I see who is the admin of a project?
answer: You can see who the administrators are by going to the 'Members' list for that project. Users with the 'Admin' role will be clearly marked.

question: Can I see a simple to-do list view?
answer: Yes, the 'List' view in the 'Tasks' section is a straightforward to-do list. You can use the checkbox next to each item to mark it as complete.

question: How do I share a file with just one person in the project?
answer: All files in a project are visible to all members. The best way to share a file with just one person is to send it to them in a direct message.

question: How do I start a video meeting?
answer: In a chat or project discussion, look for a video camera icon. Clicking this will start an integrated video call with the person or group, which will open in a new browser tab.

question: Can I see which students are online right now?
