answer: From your faculty dashboard or the course roster, you can often see the online presence indicator (a green dot) next to each student's name, showing you who is currently active on the platform.

question: I'm having trouble connecting to the server.
answer: If you can't connect to the server, please first check your own internet connection. If your internet is working, there may be a temporary outage on our end. Please check our System Status page for any known issues.

question: Can my university see my data?
answer: Your university has administrative oversight of the platform. Authorized administrators from your university may have the ability to access data for administrative, security, or compliance purposes, in accordance with the institution's policies.

question: Can I delete my profile picture?
answer: Yes, you can remove your profile picture. Go to 'Edit Profile', and next to your picture, you should see an option to 'Remove' or 'Delete' it, which will revert it to a default placeholder icon.

question: How do I filter the activity feed?
answer: The activity feed can be filtered to show only certain types of events. For example, you can filter it to show only new comments, only task updates, or only file uploads.

question: Can I assign a task to 'everyone'?
answer: Yes, when assigning a task, you can select multiple assignees. To assign it to everyone, you would need to select every member of the project from the assignee list.

question: Can I see how much space a folder is using?
answer: This feature may vary. Some views will show the aggregate size of all files within a folder, while others may require you to view the files individually.

question: Can I get an email when someone sends me a direct message?
answer: Yes, by default, you will receive an email notification for new direct messages. You can manage this and other email preferences in your 'Notification Settings'.

question: Can I see all the files submitted by a single student?
answer: You can see all files uploaded by a student within a specific project by filtering the project's activity log. There is no single view that aggregates all files from one student across all of their different projects.

question: My browser is warning me the site is 'not secure'.
answer: If you see a 'not secure' warning, it means your connection is not being encrypted with HTTPS. Please ensure your URL starts with `https://`. If it does and you still see a warning, do not enter any information and contact our support team immediately.

question: What is the acceptable use policy?
answer: The Acceptable Use Policy (AUP) outlines the rules for using our platform, such as prohibitions against harassment, academic dishonesty, and illegal activities. It is part of our overall Terms of Service.

question: How do I update my email address?
answer: Your email address is tied to your official university account and serves as your primary identifier. It cannot be changed. If your official university email changes, you will need to contact support to migrate your account.

question: How do I create a new project using a template I made?
answer: When you click 'Create New Project', you will be given the option to choose a template. Your own saved templates will appear in a 'Custom' or 'My Templates' tab in this selection window.

question: Can I have multiple task lists in one project?
answer: Yes, you can create multiple task lists to organize your tasks into different categories or stages. For example, you could have separate lists for 'Research', 'Writing', and 'Review'.

question: Can I see a preview of an audio file?
answer: Yes, you can play audio files like MP3s and WAVs directly in the browser. When you click on an audio file, it will open an in-browser player.

question: How do I find a specific discussion forum?
answer: Each project has its own discussion forum. To find it, first navigate to the correct project from your dashboard, and then click on the 'Discussion' tab within that project.

question: Can I see a timeline view for all my courses?
answer: Your faculty dashboard includes a master timeline or calendar that aggregates the key dates and deadlines from all the projects in all the courses you oversee, giving you a high-level portfolio view.

question: The 'download' button is not working.
answer: If the download is not starting, it could be blocked by your browser's pop-up blocker or a security extension. Please check your browser settings to ensure downloads from our site are allowed. Trying a different browser can also help diagnose the issue.

question: Can I delete a specific comment I made?
answer: Yes, you can almost always delete your own comments. Hover over the comment you wish to remove, and you should see a 'Delete' option in the menu.

question: Where can I see my university name?
answer: Your affiliated university or institution is typically displayed on your main profile page.

question: Can I see a list of my favorite projects?
answer: Yes, your main dashboard will have a dedicated 'Favorites' section at the top, showing all the projects you have starred for quick and easy access.

question: Can I see the total time estimated for all tasks?
answer: Yes, the project dashboard or task list view often shows a summary of the total estimated time for all tasks, as well as the total time that has been logged so far.

question: Can I see all files uploaded on a specific date?
answer: Yes, you can sort the file list by the 'Date Modified' column. You can also use advanced search filters to find files uploaded within a specific date range.

question: How do I know if I have unread messages?
answer: The main 'Chat' icon in the navigation bar will display a notification badge (e.g., a red number) indicating how many unread direct messages or group chats you have.

question: Can I reset a student's password?
answer: No, for security reasons, faculty members cannot reset student passwords. Students must use the 'Forgot Password' link on the login page to reset their own password via their university email.

question: I can't see the latest updates on the page.
answer: If you are not seeing the latest content, your browser is likely showing you a cached (saved) version of the page. Please perform a hard refresh by pressing Ctrl+Shift+R (on Windows) or Cmd+Shift+R (on Mac).

question: How do I report a copyright violation?
answer: If you believe your copyrighted work has been posted on our platform without authorization, please follow the procedure outlined in our DMCA Policy, which is linked in our Terms of Service.

question: How do I unfavorite a project?
answer: To unfavorite a project, simply go to that project's page and click the star icon again. This will remove it from your 'Favorites' list on the dashboard.

question: How do I change the project start date?
answer: The project's start date can be edited by an admin in the 'Project Settings' section, alongside the project's due date.

question: Can I filter tasks by multiple assignees?
answer: Yes, the task filtering system is flexible. You can select multiple people in the 'Assignee' filter to see all tasks assigned to any of those selected individuals.

question: Can I see which files have no tags?
answer: Yes, in the advanced file search or filter options, you can specifically filter for files where the 'Tags' field is empty or 'is not set'.

question: Can I leave a reaction on a message?
answer: Yes, you can leave an emoji reaction on any message. Hover over the message and click the reaction icon (usually a smiley face) to pick an emoji.

question: How do I remove a student from my course roster?
answer: Removing a student from your course in SynKro is typically done by removing them from the course in your university's official LMS. The change will then sync automatically to our platform.

question: I can't log out of my account.
answer: If the 'Log Out' button isn't working, it might be a temporary script error. As a workaround, you can manually log out by clearing your browser's cookies for our website.

question: Can I use a VPN with SynKro?
answer: Yes, you can use a VPN. However, if you experience connection or performance issues, please try temporarily disabling your VPN to see if it is the cause, as some VPNs can interfere with network requests.

question: Can I change my profile from public to private?
answer: All profiles are considered semi-private, visible only to other verified users within your institution's network. There is no option for a fully public or fully private profile.

question: How do I see who is working on what right now?
answer: The project's Kanban board ('Board' view) is the best way to see who is working on what. It shows which tasks are in the 'In Progress' column and displays the profile picture of the person assigned to each task.

question: Can I see the total time logged for all tasks in a list?
answer: Yes, if you are using time tracking, the task list view can be configured to show a column with the total time logged for each task, and a summary of the total at the bottom.
